        I'm back in Berkeley! Finally! I went 5 days sober, after 2 months
of smoking pot about 5 or more times a day, and smoking out at least once or
twice everyday for a year before that! Sure, I took days off now and then,
but never 5 days sober! That lets me know I can stop when I want to, and
that's nice to know(although those first two night were REALLY hard to sleep
through...)

        I missed Freedom and feel lame, because it seems everyone went
except me. I was in Granite Bay, which is like, 45 minutes east of
Sacramento.  My parents moved there after I moved here, so I knew no one
there and spent my time being incredibly bored, but I got things done. I
also hooked up with some fatty fireworks from Georgia(my dad and I are
pyromaniacs)and we lit so many until we got bored. I grew up with fireworks
and I can't bear to be apart from them even though the laws here are real
strict to weed out idiots who screw it up for everyone else. I love
fireworks! I love the sense of danger you get from them, that's half the
fun! Anyways, it was like, 95+ degrees everyday outside so I'm glad to be back.

        But I got an idea. Next time my parent go on vacation(which will be
later this summer)I should organize something up there! My parents live on
Folsom Lake, which is huge! There are only like, 20 or so houses which are
actually on the lake(the rest is a state park)and at night, the temperature
stays around a nice 70 degrees or so, perfect weather for an all night,
outdoor party on the lake! Maybe I could stretch it multiple days! Just
ideas to throw out.

        I also am sad that I missed all of you at freedom, I wanted so bad
to meet all of you since I haven't yet(except for Rebel and Kawai)... So I
await the next chance to dance... I was so fiending for techno I had to
watch Amp, which suprisingly, wasn't too bad all the time(they actually
beat-match videos now, and mix them up a little sometimes.) But those ATR
videos, oh boy, I don't know how much of that I can stand.

        As you can tell, I have too much energy. Time to smoke, I'm back,
and I'm a stoner again. I got my turntables right here! I'm ready for action....

        -chris(If you guys ever meet me, you'll realize I talk in this same
stream-of-consciousness manner)

On Thu, 3 Jul 1997, Janelle Brown wrote:

> Hello all -
> 
> I'm heading out to Southeast Asia in a month or two. I've heard that the
> Thai beaches are kinda like Goa with full moon parties and full-on beach
> raves.... was wondering if anyone had been out there recently and knew
> where I should go to find said parties? I've also heard that the police
> have been pretty harsh on cracking down on them....Any opinion on the scene
> out there? See or skip?
> 
> thanks,
> Janelle
> 
> 
> hmm...thailand DOES have an excellent dance scene, tho you'll have 
 to do some serious searching before you'll get to the heart of it all.
 quark records(siam square soi4)have an okay dance section upstairs.
 come by on a saturday afternoon and chat with expatriate junglist
 Bee about possible goings on in town.here you may also find fliers 
 for some of the larger underground events, but don't count on it...  
 silom soi 4 is generally pretty frisky come friday or saturday night
 ...passionately queer and deliriously decadent, it's home to dp 2000,  
 one of the most hammer n tongs tekno clubs i've ever had the pleasure of 
 collapsing in. if the notion of k'd up drag queens voguing to gabberhouse
 trips yr switch, then this may become your new home. further
 up the block is divine, which used to host some interesting afterhours
 action, but may be no more as of this writing...the israeli backpacker
 massive tends to convene at star bar, (temple end of khao san rd. hard
 to describe where exactly. ask around...) where falang djs slam trance    
 dats till dawn most nights. i don't like it here. you may. another
 longstanding thai tekno institution is saturday's passion at narcissus
 (sukumvit soi 25, again, not easy to find the first few times...)
 beautiful venue,awesome sound, and okay music, but the door price is
 high and the vibe is bad at best...still, a good place to find out about 
 undergrounds and such like. thai night life changes constantly, so this
 may all be completely out of date...the traveller trance scene on ko
 phangan is okay. slightly better than goa,imho. the music is more
 advanced(turntables!),the atmosphere is kooler overall,and the 
 locals actually seem to dig it for the most part... a club called
 harmony operates here during the high season(nov-may).they play trance,
 and on a good night, blow away everything happening outside of the
 capital,full moons included...yes, partiers are occasionally arrested
 or harrassed by police in hat rin ...these folks are usually either
 stupidly indiscrete or set up...watch out, but don't be too worried...ko
 samui sucks en total...avoid at all costs...anyway, i hope this is 
 of some assistance...     
 

                                  seu-a-fon,
                                     calliope

At 7:34 PM -0400 7/6/97, KAKennyA@aol.com wrote:
>Hi. If you're a weed guru, maybe you can help me.
>
>I'm sure you've heard of "brown" weed, right? It's that low-grade stuff that
>sells for about half as much as better quality stuff. Anyway, I was just
>wondering why anyone would want to "make" brown, if they have any control
>over it.
>
>Anyway, I was just curious. =)
>
>Mortimer

Scales of economy, not everyone can afford a bag of green for $50, so they
buy the browm at greatly discounted rates.  The same applies to booze, why
do people drink that, er, stuff called budweiser and NOT a good beer like
Newcastle , Sameul Adams triple bock, or Chimay?  Some people have no taste
(given), but I think it's more a factor of economics than taste.

I am not a weed guru, but I play one on TV.

Peace,
John

P.S.  Also accessibility (my girlfriend informed me).  Back east it is
probalby harder to find the kind than here.  Let's face it, the best is
often from teh west, we are spoiled by a really good climate (fairly much
year round), very fertile soil, and relatively lax law enforcement (in SF
it is a no priority item).

Peace.

males polenating the females. The females then start puting their energy

To make it short - I HAD A BLAST!!!
Fortunately for me, I had been to the site of Freedom in the past and knew to bring a dust mask.  I just felt bad when at least 3 other people asked me if I had any more and I didn't.  It was SO cute how we all looked like smiling, dancing powdered donuts by morining!!

I was in the thick of it - front and center between the two speakers about 15 people thick from the dj booth.  Something about being in the heart of the dancing that is MAGIC!  I stayed there for HOURS!  

Tony did a real housey set - he always is full of surprises, as far as his mixing style.

Jon Williams just tore shit up!

Stacey Pullen - he sure knows how to make an entrance.  What an interesting style he has. It was good enough to keep my feet dancing enthusiastically.  

The morning set was so great.  We finally left around 9 and it was nice, sunny and hot.  Something us San Franciscans don't get enough of!

See ya next time!

Amy

At 7:14 PM -0700 7/6/97, FREAK ZONE! wrote:
>At 07:34 PM 7/6/97 -0400, KAKennyA@aol.com wrote:
>>Hi. If you're a weed guru, maybe you can help me.
>>
>>I'm sure you've heard of "brown" weed, right? It's that low-grade stuff that
>>sells for about half as much as better quality stuff. Anyway, I was just
>>wondering why anyone would want to "make" brown, if they have any control
>>over it.
>
>
>"Brown weed is usually "commerically" grown. It is grown in huge outdoor
>crops where the males and females are not seperated. This results in the
>males polenating the females. The females then start puting their energy
>into producing seeds instead of THC (the stuff that gets you stoned).
>
>

That accounts for the weed to have a less stoney effect, and being "seedy",
but it does not explain the brown color, which I think is due to how the
weed is cured.  For instance what you say is correct, but you can also find
less potent and seedy green weed.

After all there are only two types: sinse (sic) (totally seedless female
bud), and, er the other.

When I was in Florida as a youth, brown was everywhere.  Why?  Primarily
because the stuff was being dumped out of planes in leaky bags into salt
water, and then later dried out, producing the famous borwn.  And yes, some
was sinse, but it was hard smokin'!

I dunno...is it curing or is it THC?  I say curing, anyone else?


>
>

>I dunno...is it curing or is it THC?  I say curing, anyone else?

Its the curing that makes it brown, but the curing itself removes a portion of the THC from the plant (I hear anyways).

Also, maybe the curing method itself may be more cost-effective and/or rapid. Okay, lets say yer a producer and brown takes
like 3 hours to cure with artificial lights whereas green takes a week. The drawback is potency but if you have a heavy demand you
might need to get it out on the streets faster :P. It would make sense to produce brown if that were the case
but this is all speculation anyways. just my 2 pennies. 


Hugs, Diego

Hi everybody!

I had such a blast!  I knew just as soon as everyone got in that big ol'
circle at sunset that the vibe was going to be insane (insane in a GOOD
way, mind you...)  My tent was set up right in the frontrow of tents,
directly in the center between the speakers, right where I could sit on
my lawn chair and see everybody dance and enjoy the laser show above my
head.  (Man, those lasers combined with the stars in the sky is such an
excellent trip...) I bought a whole bag of Jolly Ranchers and passed them
out to everyone... (a great way to meet people, may I add...)  Met some
extremely friendly people from Sac, San Luis Obispo, and Malibu even!

but...

I can't sEEm to rEmEmbEr what happEnEd to mE betwEEn thE hours of around
12:30 to about 4:00 except:

*I met (the now-infamous) Ben and Iris!  (Two of the most friendliest
people you will ever meet, by the way...)
*I met some other people (sorry I can't remember any names besides Ben &
Iris...  was it Melanie, Amy, George, and Juan???  I feel so bad not
remembering...)
*We took a picture, which will be up on my website soon... 
*And the last thing I remember was waiting by the water table wondering
where the rest of all you SFRavers were...  wasn't there supposed to be a
big group hug at 2AM?  

Oh yeah... I have to say that watching the sun rise on the top of the
hill with about a hundred of your fellow ravers is something that makes
Freedom such a wonderful party... 
<sniff>it was so beautiful... <wiping tear from eye>you guys are the
best... i think i'm gonna cry...  ;-)

Luv all of ya!!!!!
Jay
(doughboy!)

<poke my belly and i go "hee-hee">

P.S.  I have to ask this question--  Someone told me last night that I
"don't look like the raving type" (i guess it was my clothing or
something- I had a Raiders jersey on)  Just what exactly is "the raving
type" supposed to look like? It's not like I stand by the entrance
mumbling the word "doses" over and over to everyone that walks by...

The comment kinda pissed me off, kinda didn't...  ya know?   =p

Your funny.

Actually.. In basic nStuff language.. Brown weed is just not as good as
green weed. There for it is not worth as much. 

Amongst other things like.
 Brown weed is usually picked from the ground prematturely, where green
weed is grown up to it's full potential. Which may add up to more labor
charges.
 Most green weed is made right here in the US of A. Brown weed is usually
imported from another country, Concealed in harsh enviorments like dirt for
months. And who wants to pay more money for dirty old weed?
 Green weed is usually grown in an artificial enviorment that makes the
plant produce more of it's pontential organic compounds. Which in the end
cost more money too.


 Or maybe.. Some brilliant pot head, one day decided he was going to go out
and make himself a less costly weed, so that people without jobs could
still smoke pot. Hense forth, Econo-Bud.


 I need to goto bed.
 Jeff

driving down the street with the windshield wipers on in the middle of a
sunny afternoon?

are the kind of people that spread around there opinions untell they have
just about everybody thinking there facts. The type that goes around
talking shit and making fun of people they don't understand. The "poor
loser" type. That high school "follow" the leader type.

good. Even at other peoples expence.

At 3:55 AM +0000 7/7/97, Vanessa & Miccaela  wrote:
>Well, I'm looking at some of my flyers and I see some names I kind of
>recognize, either from friends, the list, or other parties, and I was
>wondering whether anyone could offer some information about them, e.g. what
>kind of music do they specialize in, why you like them or not, what kind of
>parties they do, etc. etc.
>
>So here's those names:
>

>1.  Jeno

Basically he's the shit in SF, and all places in between.  Probably the
most influential DJ in the bay area.  And dare I say if it weren't for
Jeno, who has brought in so many styles of house music (including but not
limited to trance, chicago trax, techno, happy house, garage, deep house,
and breakbeat) many people wouldn't be DJ's, there probably would be only
one record store (BPM), and you wouldn;t have the plethora of house music
that you have today.  His influence is far reaching, his standards?  Yet to
be matched.  The ultimate mental DJ.

>2.  Tony

Tony's first gig that I remeber was the VERY FIRST Basics in 93.  He played
@ the Wet Studios and from that time on I know *I* wanted him to play for
Vortex.  Great freindly guy who has a smile for everyone, and has nary a
bad word to say.  He's also one bomb of a DJ.  I credit tony with being one
of the first of the newer DJ's to really develop his own sound and kinda
broke away from the "I wanna be play like Jeno" trap so many up&coming
DJ's fall into.

>3.  Garth

Oy vey, Garth...what is there to say.  Part of the Wicked crew since it's
inception.  Part of the Jeno/Garth mega tag team.  Remeber Wicked's inb the
basement of 1015 on Fridays?  Garth has layed down so many groovy grooves
and has made so many people happy with his style of music he is the one
when it comes to getting a floor moving, and geting butts shaking, it can
only be Garth.  he too has a following and his influence can be heard in my
opinion, in Simon's playing.  Now I haven't heard Simon in a while, but I
do know at one point Garths influence was clear in Simons music as well as
other noted bay area DJ's.

>4.  Ethan

SFR's own.  My history with Ethan starts with arguing, as I beleive over
boycotts.  From that point Ethan & Bryce began the party known as friends &
family.  He's is part of the "Techno Warriors" here in the city.  Ethan, I
must give props to, because he was WAAAAY ahead of the curve when it camer
to techno.  If fact, Ethan was playing techno when it was getting little
shrift from househeads like myself.  I remember berating him about anything
over 120-124 bpm.  But Ethan, a ture warrior kept his faith, and whadday
know?  Now everryone is on the Techno bandwagon since it is the latest new
thing...;)  Now we have MAD, F&F, and Ethan is ubiquitous with Techno here
in the bay area.  And from what I understand through the underground wire,
he's the shit when it comes to playing it (I remeber when he got dex).
He's also here on the list as one of the silent "old-skoolers".


>5.  Mars
>6.  Myster-E
>7.  J.P.
>8.  Markus Mark
>


I don't know the rest of these personages.  Amybe someone can fill in the
blanks and or make corrections.

Peace,
John



>Oh, and any input on any other notable djs (especially from Sac, or that do a
>lot of Sac parties, but Bay Area dj info is good too) would be appreciated.
>
>xoxo--Miccaela

Hello, and good_morning to all.

Well I must say that I was impressed with this event.  I got there about
11:00 thinking the line of cars to get in was going to take forever, but to
my surprise it actually went really smooth.  After getting searched and let
in I was bombarded by multiple pushers, it was a bit funny to say it
nicely.  We headed towards the chill spot and I believe Joe Rice was on his
marathon run (3hrs).  Yes, Daniel did not show.  

Checked out the stands where the water was and saw a very close and dear
friend of mine who I never saw again unfortunately (hope you had a good
time).  I ended up seeing a lot of people I knew and met a lot of new
friends in the process as well.  As we got ourselves situated we headed for
the Viberation tent (homebase).  Thanks Mike and Terry! =)  We kicked it
for awhile and then headed out to hear an amazing set by Spun (jason).  I
haven't heard him in a VERY long time and it was re_freashing and moving.
My feet just started kicking up dust(pun intended) and I was off...  The
sound system was fully dialed in when Spun was on, what happened to it
around 5:30 or so???  It just sounded really bad.

N_e_ways, I left that area to check out what I came for.........NOEL!  This
guy had me dancing for sometime.  Nice set.  Wonderful sound system.  Well
after an hour I headed to the main area to check out Jon Williams.  Good
minimal techno.  Stacy Pullen was one dj that took me by surprise.  This
man was twisting my brain.  He was just unpredictable and had a very unique
mixing style.  I enjoyed it very much.

I was kicking it in the back of the dj booth at some point enjoying the
view of happy energetic people.  I must say that the vibe at this event was
pretty damn good.  Everyone was very nice and polite.  The crowd just kept
growing and growing I have no idea how many people were actually there, but
with that many people and still keeping a thick vibe was amazing enough for
me.  

I did a lot of dancing believe it or not.  I'm not one to dance to much. =)
 I walked around most of the night never really staying in one place for to
long.  At some point during the night my ride was tired and went home.
That left me to walk and socialize with everyone, and this I did.  It was a
great party and I'm glad I went.

The sun_rise was very cool.  Tons of people walking up the hill to watch a
wonderful and hot sun_rise.  Everyone had on a smile and it was so nice to
actually be able to see some of these faces I've been bumping into all night.

I left around 8:30.  Dirty as all hell and dust in every possible place.
The dust was my only real gripe.  My eyes were hating me all night long.
That and Dan(micron), my ride to Oakland, losing his keys and somehow
finding them on the bleachers in the morning.  That was just pure lucky.
Thanks for the ride Dan.  Sorry for getting us lost... =)

Thanks goes out to Martin great event, Greg your a wonderful friend, Terry
and Mike You guys are just to cool. =)  And to all the other wonderful
people I shared the night with either in person or in spirit you all are
just amazing.  For a massive I was simply impressed.

Have a good day!


   S       i       p       h       o       n
________________________________________________
http://www.geocities.com/SunsetStrip/Alley/7995
____Should_vegetarians_eat_animal_crackers?_____

At 10:10 PM 7/6/97, Doughboy on E wrote:
<snip>
>P.S.  I have to ask this question--  Someone told me last night that I
>"don't look like the raving type" (i guess it was my clothing or
>something- I had a Raiders jersey on)  Just what exactly is "the raving
>type" supposed to look like? It's not like I stand by the entrance
>mumbling the word "doses" over and over to everyone that walks by...
>
>The comment kinda pissed me off, kinda didn't...  ya know?   =p

that's the thing. we're _all_ raving types. it's the love of the music, the
dance, the energy that makes one so. not the clothes (s)he wears, the drugs
(s)he does.... it's what's inside. anybody who has to classify a person by
their appearance, imho, has a long way to go before becoming a mature
raver/person (whatever that is!). *yawn* i graduated from high school 12
years ago.... enough of the bullshit already. i guess i have the most
respect for the ppl who follow their own path, who are true to themselves
and don't follow the dictates of some fad. if you love the music, you're a
raver. if you love the diversity that the scene brings, even better! this
(diversity) is what makes us as a group so unique. anyway, who wants to be
judged by the clothes on their back? not me....

cheers - e. :)

Hiya, all...
... had 24 hours to recover from freedom6, still struck by the same question:

Why were only 1/10, 1/20 of the people dancing? Music was loud, people
seemed nice enough, but it was really distressing to be surrounded (at both
dance areas) by undancing folks, just milling around eyeing things ...
Would have been fine if there were simply periods of non-dancing, or
smallish groups of non-dancers, but I found myself all night wandering
around trying to find (and failing to find) any group of people dancing
dense enoguh so as to get that ever-spiraling-upwards
getting-energy-from-other-dancers thing...

Not to knock the event - good free water, friendly crowd, but it felt more
like a state fair than a party.

Anyone else or am I a stick-in-the-mud?

-canton

X-Sun-Charset: US-ASCII

Precedence: bulk

some words about the Freedom party:

I noticed the unusually high concentration of Acura Integras on the
road around us and surmised that we were getting close to the site,
and seconds later we arrived at what looked like a more friendly
version of Mad Max's Thunderdome.  

The initial impact was *awesome*.  As we pulled up behind a pack of
cars waiting to get in, a cop in his car drove by our van ... I smiled,
and he ***WAVED and SMILED***.  This set my initial vibe-o-meter at 
around 'really good'.  

It was like a rave circus.  Wads of tents with people rolling around
in, on, and around them.  People mingling, talking, dancing, and wiggling.
A lack of people trying to push drugs obnoxiously to me.  (except right
when I got inside)  The jungleish room was pretty amazing for most of the
night -- whoever was on at about 1 was _ripping it up_.  (Noel?)  Later
in the same area I heard someone mix KRS-ONE and Blondie, which made my
body tingle and nearly made me fall down (literally, I lost my balance).
Dusty, dusty, dusty.. I have muddy boogers.  :)  Next time a dust mask.
The hills surrounding the event were sweet, as were the stars which I've
missed since moving to SF. 

The bigger dancefloor seemed nice .. I only danced out there about 4:50 or
so when we all danced the sun up.  What a sweet sunrise.  Gave out some
fruit.  Saw a guy giving out roses.  Climbed up onto the hillside with
about 1,000 of my close friends and watched as the sun rose over the
carnivalesque environment.  

Danced more.  Danced more.  Hugged people.  Got glittered up.  Danced.
Hugged people.  Yay.

First-rate, especially from a Floridian's point of view, as any party
this size in Florida would have had much less dancing and much more
static.  (I saw no altercations - yay!)

Kudos to the producers ... my body hurts!

-jon

Hey all!!!!

   Rubilicious here!!!!! Man, it seems like forever since I've posted 
a Review. But anyways, I just have to say that FREEDOM was bomb!!! I 
have never been to a party that has lasted that long and it was just 
awsome I didn't want to leave when it was over. I saw so many of you 
beautiful sfravers and it made my time so much better because I had 
a chance within' a big ass massive to still feel that underground vibe
that is so seldom felt at massives. So, much love to you guys!!!! 

You see, the story is as follows: my Friend flaked on me to go to 
FREEDOM so I decided to go by my lonesome. I knew I would be able to 
still have fun by myself, but it was so intimidating to find anyone at 
a massive that large all by myself in the dark! Lucky for me I found you
guys and I also met alot of new ravers that weren't on the list:) I had
too much fun and I got one of those bombin' new laminates(thanks 
chand in blue and girlfriend: you guys are gorgeous)A quick Hi to 
Christine the candygirl, finally we meet! Pricilla, it was bomb to see
your smilin' face again:) And of course to the regulars( it's not a 
party without you guys) Beth, Byroni,LaNG,Paula ect..... I love you 
guys. 
And I'm not forgetting you Deepfog: thanks for the "Doughnuts" :) And to
everybody else that blessed me with your presence that night who I may
have forgotten your names(But not your smilin' faces): Much hugs to 
you guys!!!!!!!!OH, and the reuniting of the rave princesses (you know
who you are!!) was one of my favorite episodes of the night too :) :)


Nevertheless I would have to say that the morning music sets were 
awsome!!! My most favorite part of the whole rave would have to be 
dancing on top of the stage while the sun was new in the sky and that 
guy was singing live! WOW!!!! It was soo cool from up there, you could
see everyone dancing down below, you could see the people on the
 mountains,it was freakin'amazing. 

Oh well, I just thought I'd share my happiness wich ya'll.


                 Peace,Love, and Sparklies,

                                   rubilicious

Subject: Regarding brown weed...
X-Sun-Charset: US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

The reason one sees brown weed is the same reason why one sees
large, rolling hills of golden grass -- the sun.  Many Mexican
and to a lesser extent Jamaican marijuana farmers dry their
crop by laying branches out in the sun over racks, and the
sun dries them; unfortunately this is not the optimum way to 
cure marijuana, and if the sun is really hot (ie nearly
equatorial) it can simply bleach out the marijuana.  Also,
be aware that this improper curing causes THC to degrade into
other cannibinoids especially CBN and CBD, which is not a good
thing from a getting-high standpoint.  Often brown weed is 
sprayed down with roach spray to make it work better.  It's
best avoided.  Also, black weed is probably moldy and as such
not such a good idea to put into your lungs.

*

jon

Set in those beautiful rolling hills, when we left at 9am we were treated
by incredible scenery.  With ok computer playing, thousands of windmills
as far as the eye could see harnessed the earth's energy.  Which is
exactly what everyone at Freedom was doing, harnessing energy of music,
light, and love.  Brilliant...!

My first outdoor rave, and one of my faves.  Being outside completely
grounded me and kept me lovin' and dishing it out.  Some of the positives
that I can remember; the beautiful star quilt above the freakout room,
laser designs projected against a sheer rock face, the hillside sunset,
the windmills, tent city, dancing with my nitrous balloon (if you do it
just so, oh oh my!!), smokin bowls with guys on the freakout stage (one
guy had the most beautiful flowing  red afro), dancing with incredibly
charismatic (cute) people (hi selwa, juan, chris, amber, aubrey!), meeting
some sfravers (mr doughboy, ben, iris, amy)  didn't really get to hang out
with ya'll.  And last of all, cleaning my nose at the end of it all.  I
think I could have thrown a small pot from all the clay that came out!
buhahaha!!  

Some criticisms, I really wish the DJ lineup was posted.  Only good can
come of it.  Actually it pisses me off.  If someone could give me a
logical reason, please?  I would say it should be a fairly high priority,
up there with decorations and stuff.  Come on promoters, let the masses
know who's spinnin' so that we can buy their mix-tapes, go to parties
where they spin, and talk shit about them :).  Sure I ask people around
the booth who's spinning, but it really would be so great.  ALL parties
should let the masses know who's spinning somehow.  IMHO.

And then there were all the leadfooted people loitering around the dj
booth.  Move over bacon, cuz here comes something meatier.  If you were a
dj, whould you rather have people freakin out in front of you or have
people watch your technique and learn.  I dunno, i'm no dj, but the freaky
people reciprocate what the dj gives.  So, what i did and will start doing
is try to get the watchers moving.  It sort of worked but it would help if
I wasn't going solo.  I love watchin the dj sp[n too, and I love dancin',
so if you're just watchin, I think I'm gonna bump you out.  Let's form a
little pep squad.  Who's in?! 

One last thing, how do you approach someone and let them know you want to
cuddle?

I had an amazing time.  Love to all.

Georgie Porgie

To listen to the netcast from 1015 Folsom, open up your realaudio player, and use the "open location" command (under the file menu). Cut and paste this line in:

pnm://realaudio.hotwired.com/audiolab/broadcast/betalounge2/lounge7.1.ra

Hit return and you'll get an earful.

We'll have it up soon on the Beta Lounge remix page, where there will be proper links, pictures, etc. That's at:

http://www.betalounge.com/remix.html

Like many have said, brown weed is due to curing process.  BUT, brown weed
does not always mean schwag.  Usually brown weed is from out of the
country, mass produced and smuggled in.  The sun breaks down most of the
green pigments (ie, chlorophyll) when the stalks are cut down and sun
dried.  Microbial activity also affects the color.  When they press
the buds into bricks, you get something along the lines of a compost pile
of grass.

I must say that, while brown weed doesn't have the fine bouquet of flava', 
that don't mean it aint got the chemical goodies.  Ever heard of Columbian
Red, Acapulcan Gold, Oaxacan, Jamaican?  These equatorial varieties
(sativa) are trippy, mind-fucking, psychedelic grass that comes into US
brown.  Now if you lived down in these areas, and got to cure your own
you'd be in for one hell of a treat!  You'd have green buddha, and you
might glimpse satori.  

geORGIE

> cars waiting to get in, a cop in his car drove by our van ... I
smiled,
> and he ***WAVED and SMILED***.  This set my initial vibe-o-meter at 
> around 'really good'.  
> 
> It was like a rave circus.  Wads of tents with people rolling around
> in, on, and around them.  People mingling, talking, dancing, and
wiggling.
> A lack of people trying to push drugs obnoxiously to me.  (except
right
> when I got inside)  The jungleish room was pretty amazing for most
of the
> night -- whoever was on at about 1 was _ripping it up_.  (Noel?) 
Later
> in the same area I heard someone mix KRS-ONE and Blondie, which made
my
> body tingle and nearly made me fall down (literally, I lost my
balance).
> Dusty, dusty, dusty.. I have muddy boogers.  :)  Next time a dust
mask.

I've
> missed since moving to SF. 
> 
> The bigger dancefloor seemed nice .. I only danced out there about
4:50 or
> so when we all danced the sun up.  What a sweet sunrise.  Gave out
some
> fruit.  Saw a guy giving out roses.  Climbed up onto the hillside
with
> about 1,000 of my close friends and watched as the sun rose over the
> carnivalesque environment.

Danced.

> First-rate, especially from a Floridian's point of view, as any party
> this size in Florida would have had much less dancing and much more

 Mon, 07 Jul 1997 12:24:14 -0700
X-Sender: branka@pop.sirius.com
Message-Id: <v03102804afe6e9fbde8b@[205.178.40.25]>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Date: Mon, 7 Jul 1997 12:23:21 -0700
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: *B* <branka@sirius.com>
Subject: A different review of Freedom (long)
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

My opinion is pretty much different than of many people on the list, but
why not share that as well.

I went last year, and although I had an OK time, I decided to go this year
as well.  The main reasons were that it was one of my best friend's B-Day
who really wanted to go, and it was an outdoor party (got to love those).

After a nice BBQ (with good DJs sets at my friend's house in Marin) we
started the journey.  I was really looking forward to it, and hoping we
would catch Doran's set....  As things go (lag, lag), we ended up at
Freedom by midnight, and after parking, being searched etc. we finally made
it inside and missed Doran.

I was so ready to dance and have fun, but somehow the music didn't do it
for me the entire night.  I guess I just know what I like, but there was no
trance to be found anywhere at the party.  I was glad I came with my best
friends, because that made things better, and I was able to hang out with
them and have some fun.    I danced for some of the night, but that wasn't
dancing because music was good, it was dancing because I was bored and I
like dancing.  Although I really *love* mornings, I was ready to leave when
my friends suggested it (around 7am).  So in case you didn't go, and you
are regretting it - don't - maybe you would feel about it the same way I do
- it was an OK party, but can't compare with many, many other parties I've
attended it the past, and I know I will not go next year.  I am happy so
many other people had fun :) - at least not everybody felt the same way I
did...

Good parts of the party:
- it was warm, and it was nice to be able to dance in a T-shirt all night
- hanging out with my best friends and being silly
- seeing people I know and chatting with them
- getting candy in the morning from this really nice girl who was dancing
close to us for a while
- exchanging smiles with this cute boy while dancing and running into him
at the gas station after the party

Not so good parts of the party
- this guy who was "out" of it and kept dancing close to us and screaming
"Where is Pete?  There he is!" while pointing to the sky.  He was jumping
around, hitting people (by accident, because he was so out it - one of my
friends tried to talk to him, but the guy was gone).  I hope he was OK -
hope somebody managed to help him....
- flashlights - can anything get more annoying than people walking on the
dance floor and flashing lights in your face while you are dancing
- no trash cans - it would be great if there were more places to put your
empty water bottles and other trash - for $25 that's the least that could
be provided.
- dust and people constantly asking me if I had vapor rub in my dust mask
- MUSIC (I already bitched about that one)
- seeing the accident on the way back.  I hope nobody got majorly hurt (I
saw somebody on the strecher, but hope they are OK)


Enough said,
=) *B*

Hi you all,

Question for any of you who were at Freedom-  Who was the DJ spinning in
the Jungle tent from about 9:30-12:30 and what would you call the style
he was spinning? He was spinning sort of a trancy hip-hop- smooth, legato
bass lines, hip-hop beats etc.  

Also this being my first post here's a quick intro-  I just moved out here
from NY.  Totally new to the SFrave scene and fairly new to the rave scene
in general though I've been listening to electronic music and computer
music for a while (even write some)- sort of came to the electronic dance
scene via the more experimental electronic music as well as a longstanding
interest in rhythmically based folk traditions (India, North Africa, West
Africa).  Anyhow glad to see a thriving scene out here, If any of you all
would like to meet up with me I'd love to meet you- drop some mail.
(either at this account or my new account pchordia@cisco.com).

Nada Brahma
Peace

Parag

piece of mUshroom pizza and off I went. too bad I completley forgot who I
was, what was going on and how to walk. I uh finally ended up sleeping in my
car and waking up to see a massive amount of people on the hill and the sun
was coming up! 

Good things: Doran's set... every other Dj's set was just a lot of bass soup
in my head... the visuals were ok.. trippy when you are sober. Scary as all
hell when you are not.

too many. the dust and the wind... and the really nasty port o potties...
YUCK!

canton wrote:

> around trying to find (and failing to find) any group of people dancing
> dense enoguh so as to get that ever-spiraling-upwards
> getting-energy-from-other-dancers thing...

You must not have been where I was:  Front and center of the DJ about 10
people back.  There was SO much energy there and it was between the
speakers so that it wasn't ear-splitting.  I stayed put there for
literally hours and hung out with one of my best friends, Ken, his
girlfriend and also Ethan and Reagan. It was so much fun:  I met folks
dancing next to me and we shared smiles and "holy shit this mix is
great" - type vibes.  You can usually find lots of high energy dancing
when you are near the dj and it was full on at Freedom!

some foolish thoughts for a monday morning....

Everyone has a photographic memory. Some don't have film.

I feel like I'm diagonally parked in a parallel universe.

Honk if you love peace and quiet.

A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.

I just got lost in thought. It was unfamiliar territory.

Atheism is a non-prophet organization.

On the other hand, you have different fingers.

Nothing is fool-proof to a sufficiently talented fool.

foolish fish

Hey Mr nStuff!
(hi to Jondabomb and Matt early in the night in the tent!)
The rest of the peole I saw were all ol' faces from the East Bay tent area whom I haven't rocked out with in ages.

Okay, here some responses from Mr. 2 for Mr nStuff ---> we've gotta hook one day and go out dancing brother!

(Katie- Sorry I didn't talk to you more @ Freedom! You're a very very cute girl! :-)
 ------
+ They were playing some really groovy tunes. But...It's all about bringing
+ some cardboard boxes next year to dance on, to vend off them "bad groove
+ trips"

Next year let's do that man.  I think I tripped over 100 rocks Saturday night.  Check out my shoes too!

+ I am having trouble understanding this line. I think your saying that you
+ danced your booty off during the DJ Spun set. But SPUN only succeeding with
+ four mixes?

Yes, my bugged out post meant to say Spun had four great tracks in a row that he played, and made me shake my butt away, like you do too.  Some tweeker in a Troy Aikman jersey got up on the laser booth and tried to be like Superman n' stuff.  My friend and I said, "Jump!"

I heard the music stop in the jungle room as well. I heard someone knocked a speaker over.
Hey, that was the smoothest dance floor you could  have the whole night man!

Peace, Mr. 2

Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Yellow,
I'm hoping that someone out there has some music business knowledge they
could bestow on a poor, uneducated, guy who's band has unpublished material
being played on the radio.  (That would be me.)

The situation:  We recorded an EP for a tiny label back in '95.  We were
less than thrilled with the finished product, and we figured nothing would
ever come of it, so we never bothered to set up our publishing co., or even
file with BMI/ASCAP for writers credits.  Well, the EP was finally released
a few months ago, and to our complete surprise, it's doing fairly well on
college radio stations.  

The question(s):  Obviously we would like to see some money from this
unexpected turn of events,(new instruments...yum) that means getting the
publishing and writers credits taken care of, has anyone out there done
this before?  The choice for DYI operations seems to be between BMI and
ASCAP, anyone have any feedback?  I've heard ASCAP is EVIL, but BMI makes
it hard to get the application to become a publisher... not that I can
decipher the stuff they have sent me.  

Our label boss recommends seeing an entertainment lawyer, anyone been
there/done that?  How much would that cost?

Any info/feedback would be extremely helpful!  You may want to respond
privately,  so as not to bore everyone any further...

Thanks in advance..nstuff
--ChrisP


Chris Porter
Customer Support
Explore Technologies
408-654-3846, 8-5 PST.

Dear Sf Raves

I just started going to raves on New yrs, and in my time since i have been to
many parties w/ great vibes. I think i have been spoiled from all the happy
parties i've been too.  Yesterday I went to the Vans Warp tour, it was my
last punk show i will ever attend. I was happy to see Jil (CHeerioHN), big
huggz. I love the music, but the vibe was not there. if i wanted negativity i
would just stay home. i go out to have fun, and see people give hugz, and
give hugz. but not to see people get hit in the head. Violence doesnt make me
happy. i know right now i sound like a PLURY raver. But i don't care, that is
who i am i guess. I am who i am, and i'm prouyd to be in SF underground
SCene. and i'll see you many times soon.

Hope to see everyone at @spire.

love you all 

jeremy

Hey, kids.  I picked this post up on the Washington DC/Baltibore Ravelist.
I thought it was funny & scary & beautiful  & kooky all at once.

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Boy,  I haven't truely danced an gotten into the trance for about two weeks
now and  I feel incomplete ,I feel lost. I'm trying to moderate my going out
but its got me hooked like crack and there's no place to hide. I need to lose
myself so I can find myself. Yea, thats it, I need to get lost in it, tossed
in it, let it take me to the place of no names or walls to be free from the
prizm that I cannot see that I build up in my mind when I 've been away from
it to long. I need to be released, and our beloved music is the only thing
that can do it. My love has been so deep for this that my own girlfriend of 3
1/2 years broke things off with me 4 months ago because she was jealous.
Isn't that a trip. And the funny thing is that it doesn't bother me one bit
because I know the music will be with me till the end of time!

                                I gotta run wild!
                                I need to unwind!
]                               I gotta be free!

Sup?
	I'm not gonna give a huge Freedom review except that it was Bomb as 
Fuck!  I wore my Happy Face Shirt with a Hit of Ass-Id on the tongue.  I 
just want to know if anyone else went to "Plastik" in August of 1995?  I 
went to Plastik which was at the same location as Freedom.  At Plastik, 
in the morning I saw everybody run up the Hill while the Sun was rising.  
I was NOT one of them and regreted it.  2 years later, I go to Freedom 
97 and was so excited when I found out it was in that same location.  I 
thought/knew that this would be my chance to redeem myself by going up 
the Hill in the morning.  I was with a special someone that night and 
told her to meet me at the tent at 5:30AM so that we can walk around 
together and talk.  As soon as we met at the tent, it 'clicked'.  "This 
would be perfect.  I can have my walk and climb the Hill I always wanted 
to with Her"!  We climbed the 1st hill and then saw the second & taller 
hill and climbed that one.  I took a picture of her with the whole party 
behind her in the background.  It's Beautiful.  I Love The Gathering 
Parties...

Josh "e" jOSH

Subject: frEEdom!!!!!!and some other weekend thoughts :o)
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Hey Everyone!!!!!
Gee what a weekend hunh!?!!! First a nite of spectacular fire works, a day of
skateboarding (and slurpee drinking) And there i was off to FREEDOM. Now I've
never been to one before, i knew a lot about it cuz everybody was talkin
about it, but i had no expectations. The windmills on the way casted all my
troubles, bad thoughts and whatever was on my mind into the wind, leaving me
totally centered on what it was that was going to happen later that evening.
When we pulled up, i was beyond excited, here was this track thingy in the
middle of two mountains, and a whole buncha tents. I got there real early,
the sound wasn't on yet, and others were settin up camp. I walked around, saw
some friends, checked out the area, got in trouble for climbing the big
hill(i guess they were saving the view for sunrise!) And set up our little
sanctuary of a tent. Then what i believe to be mozart(i don't know my
classical artists) came on, now that was the only scary music i heard the
whole evening. weird deep gothicish music really really loud! Then the kick
ass sunset hand holding almost a circle  rush into the middle and get down
thingy started the smile on my face that never went away!! WOW,  thank you to
everyone of you that went and added to the awsome incredable vibe that was
goin on, thanks for makin my nite oh so yummy! I was lucky enough to run into
Pyro and got a big *hug*, and i met only beth(b.) at the 2:00 meeting i
expected more but there was mad peeple in the area so o-well next time
rite!!??!!I didn't wait for long i was really inta Noels sic bomb-ass set wow
that was fun!! Well then a big B-L-U-R. YAY off to dance up the mountain, and
watch the sun make its daily apperence, what a cool thing i got
lots-o-photos! So then it was time to dance away the energy that was left,
and close camp and head out i had to meet my ride to warp tour at 10am and it
was 9am, i had just enuf time to scrape the 1/8 inch of dirt off that coated
my body, but no time to sleep, warp tour, was the exact opposite of plur~talk
about bad vibes, i used to be all inta punk rock but i do believe my likes
have changed!! Whoa, what a competative un friendly scene! i didn't mind it i
guess back then but now that raves have totally changed my ways i can't
handle the bad vibes, but i got to see Jeremy, so i got a hug YAY! I was
sleepy and got really sunburnt! now im payin for it all, im sick , so im
takin next weekend off, im gunna stay in my hermitge and drink tea So you
kids have an excellent week, don't werk to hard, and watch the pretty
sunsets!!
Mad love and HUGS out there and of corse 
P   L   U   R
~JiL~
HI MEGS!

Ok.. Deepfog is my like..E-mail buddy n'all that..

All jokes set aside though. I am compleatly serious.  I tell you, me being
a headrosexual male at the ravEs. I get verbally gay bashed more than any
of you Homosexuals do..Or how did my friend Lu say it?..Newsexual.
 

Unfortunetly, things are getting worse everytime I go...People are now
coming up with other things to call me. This time,  very negative things to
be spreading around about someone. VERY uncalled for. And pretty soon, I
might have to go postal on some of these little ones just to keep from
getting hurt physically. And ofcourse, this will make me look like the bad
guy.
Food for thought...I skinny baseball bat hurts alot more on impact than a
phat baseball bat. I am very skinny. =]

Anyways. I am just being weird today.
I love the ravE scene still. But there really should be an age limit.. Like
anyone that can act there age is aloud in.

I got it though! Once I feel up to spinning at a ravE.. (Which will happen.
I have alot of confidence in my ability to "catch the break") Anyways.. I
will just wear a giant Dread Lock wig so no one knows who I am.. Get the
whole ravE pumping with my knowledge of "whats tasty & whats not" Then
before my set is over.. Bust out with the phat red Nike sweat jacket and
tear off the wig... SURPRISE!!  Walk off stage.. Aw yea..

Mr Attitude is waking up..!


Thats it for now. I ran out of time. Cannot reply to any further posts at
this time.
Night night Mr nStuff

And for the misinterpreted people.. I am not a violent person.
Peace in your base ball cap.

Jeff

So anyways I take my Japanese exchange student to Freedom.

It was his first raving experience...except for a small prelude at CF's 4th
of july party,

I don't think he's even *heard* techno music.

We get there, set up camp, and I give him a lil prEsEnt.

Then he disappears for like 6 hours or something!!!!

I finally run into him in the morning...He's sweatin like crazy, covered
with dust, and has a big smile on his face.

I ask him, "Where the hell were you all night, I was worried!"

He says, "I ras dancing, and I couldn't reave my spot, cuz someone else
would take it...........
                  and it ras the *best* spot!"

I love raving!

much love and energy,

Hey all!

I'm not part of the SFRaves list, so you probably don't know who the 
hell I am.  My name is Todd and I'm a SoCal raver.

This weekend I got to go north and party with you guys for a change.  
What a great weekend.

It started off by going to a small gathering by Cloud Factory in 
Monteray with friends from San Jose.  Great loction, small vibey group 
of people, Chai...what more can you ask for?

Sat. was Freedom.  What a great party!  A little too much house music 
for my ears, but everyone else seemed to go ff on it, so it's all good.  
Thank God for Jon Williams.  He always seems to kick my ass!

As for Daniel not showing up....He was in Arizona on his way to Roswell 
New Mexico.  Did he know he was on the flier for Freedom?  Who knows.  
All I know is that he has been planning on playing the 50th annyversary 
of the Roswell crash for sometime now.

Sunday we went to Sunset.  What a great location and a great group of 
people, too.  Again, more disco house music.  You guys sure like that 
stuff, don't you?  We don't get much of it down here anymore.  In LA it 
would have been all trance or breaks.

Well, that's about it.....

Thanx all for the great weekend!!!!!!!!!!!!


love
Todd

PUBLIC WILL HAVE INTERNET VIEW OF PATHFINDER ACTIVITIES 

    Internet users around the world may begin following the Mars 
Pathfinder spacecraft as it approaches Mars and
prepares for a July 4 landing by way of a variety of local mirror sites 
that are now online. 

    The Internet sites feature updates on mission activities, and will 
provide Pathfinder photographs of the Martian
surface once they become available. The sites also feature a bird's eye 
view of the Mars Pathfinder mission operations
area at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Pasadena, CA, via a live video 
camera feed that is updated every 15
minutes.

I just had the funniest conversation with my Mom and I thought I'd share 
it all to you...

I was overhearing her talkin to my Dad about her going somewhere with a 
bunch of her friends...she walked out of her room, and while sitting here 
reading mail, and not really paying attention to her I impulsivly raised 
my voice to ask her...

" Where ya going? "

Not really paying much attention to me and not really feeling like giving 
me the long answer she half-sarcastically asnwered...

" Nowhere "

I jokingly replied...

" Well gee, that's a lot of people that want to go Nowhere with you..."

And, in kind of a half-dazed state, she replied...




" Well lots of people want to go nowhere..........All the time "




I was quite amuzed, and  hope you are to :P

Stay Cool!

-Matt...the other one-

-----Original Message-----
From:	Robert Pointer [SMTP:rwpointer@citiscape.com]
Sent:	Thursday, July 03, 1997 3:59 PM
To:	Janelle Brown; sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject:	Re: thailand: beach parties?

Janelle Brown wrote:

> Hello all -
>
> I'm heading out to Southeast Asia in a month or two. I've heard that
> the
> Thai beaches are kinda like Goa with full moon parties and full-on
> beach
> raves.... was wondering if anyone had been out there recently and knew
>
> where I should go to find said parties? I've also heard that the
> police
> have been pretty harsh on cracking down on them....Any opinion on the
> scene
> out there? See or skip?
>
> thanks,
> Janelle

 

I was in Thailand for 3 weeks this last January (the cool season - man,
do I pity you!) and unless you have somebody who speaks Thai you are
going to be S.O.L.
I spent 2 weeks in Bangkok and if you do not know where to look for such
things (flyers, stuff like that) you probably won't find anything.
Granted, I was there to meet my fiancee's family and I wasn't there
necessarily to party, but I was seriously on the look out for something 
cool to go to.
I suspect that most of these beach raves (if they truly exist on a
regular basis) are organized by people that are not native to Thailand.
The other thing is this: When you go out looking for these types of
parties here, you usually go to record or DJ stores or cool clothing
outlets where people know what is going on. In Thailand those places are
almost impossible to find (I looked unsuccessfully) and record stores
are completely non-existant.

Anyway, if I was you I would look for U.K. sponsored stuff where they
have special events booked over there or something. I wouldn't wait to
get to Thailand to find out.

rob.
http://www.citizenmag.com

I copied this from a poster at Freedom.

Your biggest responsibility in life is to love yourself. 
Only when you  make a commitment to love your 
body and soul in every aspect can you make a positive
change for your self or others. Do not forget that you 
are the most divine and special creature you will ever
meet. Inside of you is planted a seed of light  and
the capacity to make anything come true. As you
become aware of this tremendous power invested in you
a great power will be put into your hands.
This responsibility is to act out the truth and love and to 
make your life the most wonderful and exciting 
experience possible. As your inner light begins
to glow and expand, other peoples light will 
become activated and set in motion. The more
love you have for yourself, the more you will
radiate to others. love is contagious.The amount
available is limited only by your imagination.
As each days unfolds you will see how life transforms
itself according to the energy you have chosen to live
by. Never fear other peoples judgement, you are always
justified for the sole reason that you are a living creature
on this earth. Understand that having a good time and
being happy is your mission here in this time and place.
You are a vital part of a much bigger plan to replant
the seed of love on this planet. Live the light.


I want to make posters like this to hang at 
partys.If you have any thing similar to this
or poems, sayings...etc that you would like 
to be a part of this send them to me and 
if you would like to help in making these posters
also let me know.
We can get together for some pizza and tunes
and get out the fluorescent paints and glitter and
markers and make inspirational posters...

and any producers that want these hanging 
at you next party also email me.

You know. I am really sorry for sounding so evil on the list an all.


This message was originally spoken for one person on the list. but I want
everyone to listen.



I am pretty depressed right now. And I am still hearing voices to. Which is
annoying, because they are the voices of the evil villinz nStuff.}:\ I seem
to take them with me after the rave. I know that these people make it
difficult for me to communicate, but alot of it is still my fault. I need
to make some changes agian, adjust. I don't want to say, I am going to quit
doing that, or do this more often, but I need to work things out. And what
ever comes and goes during that time will just have to be delt with. You
know what I mean? But friends will always be friends.

It's strange. It's like, I feel it when people are listening to me talk.
And I know at an instant when someone does not understand what I am saying,
or gotten lost in my conversation, instantly. But what sucks is that, I
feel it when people are just listening to me talk to judge me, listening to
the tone of my voice searching for anomalies. Like "oh that sounded alittle
salty, he must be gay, I am going to go tell my friends" I sence this kind
of stuff. And I have even gotten proof that what I senced was right. Dozens
of times. Almos all the time. It's almost as if, I know exactly what there
feeling before they even articulate the feeling them selves. It's like I
really got to start saying "I know what your thinking" or "I know what your
trying to accomplish" But that would be crazy..So I have gotten proof, so I
have been right in the past. But what if I am not right? I would sound like
a compleat loonie. I just wish the sences would go away. I wish I wasn't so
perceptive. You know? Sounds crazy huh?

There are very few people in the ravE scene that seem to be-able to
communicate with me, or me communicate with them. People that come up to me
to talk, not just listen. I don't expect someone to do all the talking.
That is crazy. What I am saying though is, very few people in the scene
will actually come up to me, to meet me..Ask me some question, try to get
to know me. Errr.. This is all so crazy. But it happens all the time. Most
people just listen into my conversations to cast judgement. I know it's
because I am mysterious (or how do they say it in the 90's? Weird) I am
sure that I look very difficult to aproach, but I am not. You know? First
impressions are not everything. The truth of the matter is, you can not
judge people by the first impression. No one can truly know someone that
quickly.

And what is going on here around me at the raves. Totally wrong. People
either assume, or simply hear things from other. And then they just sniff
around me searching for clues to proove it. And ofcourse because they are
thinking it, they only grasp for signs that seem to point to there
assumtions. And because everyone wants to proove there right, they only
really search for what there thinking. Instead of getting the real picture.
You understand what I am saying?

And it's not all there fault. It's mine. It's my fault for closing up, or
coming off wrong because of the fact I am sencing there intentions, there
motives, or there beliefs. So the high perseption I have seems to backfire.
And I can't help it. It's like I am thinking.."Oh no, there thinking this
or that" and I get all ... Quiet agian.

It really sucks. A person with suicidel tendencies would have killed them
self long ago if they were in my shoes. Thats how much pressure I take in.
When a doctor says "you may feel alittle pressure here" to me.. It's like..
"Doc, you obviously do not have a clue as to what pressure is"

And stab me in the back. I could be the one casting to much judgement. I
just want it to stop being like this.

But it is a fact that these people are being wrong.
And the really weird part is. I don't hold a grudge with any of them. I
care for all concious beings. I don't want to see anyone lose them selves.
Even if it means losing myself to avoid it. I may despize, be hastey, or
not like someone for certian reasons. And only when thoughs reasons go
away, will I feel comfortable around them. And the reasons I am referring
to are incorrect feeling. I know what is right and what is wrong. And these
people have no right to act on there assumptions without searching for
solid verbal answers by inquiring them. And then, for them to go around
spreading there assumptions to other people is almost worse than committing
murder. When a person dies, they die who they are...But if I die right now,
thanks to these people..I die who everybody thinks I am. And they are
wrong...

I really do try to do everything right. There's just alot of things that I
can't seem to..Do right. You know?

Night nStuff.
>From a very protective person,
jEff

What's up everyone,

I went to this new weekly event called Ultra, if you're into drum and
bass you should definetly check it out, the place where it was at is
called VSF, its a very cool location, with two rooms and a  chillin
rooftop balcony.

Then it was off to MAD where some good bumpin tunes were played, and it
looke like a lot of people were having a good time dancing, I'm stoked
cause I got a Freaky Chakra vs. single cell orchestra poster.

have a good day everyone!

Pete

	for <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; Tue, 8 Jul 1997 08:43:48 -0700 (PDT)
Message-ID: <19970708154138.7236.rocketmail@send2.rocketmail.com>
Received: from [204.94.209.1] by web1; Tue, 08 Jul 1997 08:41:38 PDT
Date: Tue, 8 Jul 1997 08:41:38 -0700 (PDT)
From: Alex Ward <djscience@rocketmail.com>
Subject: Ultra went off...
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Got to the city late to find the club hadn't started on time. Once we
got in we chilled to mudfoot while chomping on the cheese, crackers
and vegetable munchies: yes, the place was in style with free food to
boot!

Anyways, J.Majik hit the decks around 11 or so and started pretty
techy with a VIP mix of the last Optical track. The floor got full
pretty fast as he laid down dub-plate one after another and soon the
vibe was very thick.

MC Justice put on his wireless mic and started layering some very
smooth rhyming over the top and then the crowd really grooving. I've
got to say, Justice was the surprise of the night: Easily the most
reserved MC I've ever seen. He knew when to hype the crowd a little
and when to step back from the mic like during some of Ed Rush's set,
who came on around 12.

Ed had a pretty incerdible set, starting off very mellow and slowly
building from deep rollers into incredibly dark and trancy steppers.
By the end the crowd was seriously going apeshit when he dropped a
track off the No U-Turn album. People were shouting and slapping
hi-fives: it was a zoo!

Anyways, Doc Scott finally stepped up to the plate and started
dropping some really interesting tracks. I only got to stay through a
third of his set, but it was very, very tight when I left.


 For the people I still hear saying 'You can't dance to jungle'...oh
my gosh...there were a few hundred nutters proving you wrong last
night! I have never seen so many smiles and looks of awe in a CLUB
before. 

Finally, Thanks to FTT for bringing the tour into sf.

-peace-

SCiEnCe

HI EVERYBODY!!!

My name is Charmayne, but most people know me as the Gabber Girl.  I just
joined your list recently . . . I'm from Minneapolis, living in Chicago
right now with my boyfriend Matter.  We are moving to Oakland, CA at the
end of the week!!!  I'm really looking forward to being a part of the bay
area scene!  I went to "Trust:Surrender", and it was the best event I've
ever been to.  The people were so  great!  Down to earth, smart,
happy--well, you know who you are!  I hadn't been to a party near that fun
since the early 1800's . . .

About me:
I appreciate every kind of music(despite all my jokes about house), but I'm
a dj that likes extremes--hard acid, hard gabber, noisecore, speedcore,
gaabbahaus, old school midwest style hard tekno, and intense, mental
jungle.  Anything that your mother would not approve of!  I like gettin
under people's skins as much as I love makin people dance!  Do not be
afraid--I won't hurt you!  Just cuz hardcore is my favorite doesn't make me
an icky person.

In Minneapolis, I was promoting small-scale hardcore events as Warrior
Princess Productions.  That's how I met Matter--he did a live pa at my last
party.  We were just crazy enough for each other that it worked out!

ATTENTION DJ'S AND RECORD COLLECTORS:

I got this post off of Mw-Raves.  It's from Mr. Bill of Milwaukee, WI.
Thought you might be interested!

howdy all,

 my name is bill, MR.BILL to most of you. as some of you might or might
 not know i make flight cases for a living.you know they're
 black(mostly), they have silver edges and steel corners with twist tyle
 latches. some of you might even have one from me.well im letting those
of
 you that dont know about them.prices start at $60 and go up from there.
 the basic size (half case) is 6.5" inside with black carpet inside.
they
 hold about 50 records. the next size up holds about 90 orso and costs
 $80, then theres the monster, holds over 100 disks has two handles and
 weights a ton full(for the marathon sets). that one costs $110. If you
 want to know more call me. my number is 414.372.2010, im at my shop mon
 thru fri 10am to 4 pm.I also make cases for turntables and amps ,and
all kinds of things.if you want a quote just ask.

 thanks for the time.

 bill wilson
 "MR.BILL"

 "rock on" dudes!

There was quite a few posts after this one of people that own his cases and
have highly recommended his work.

Well, I have to go and finish packing!  See ya in a lil bit!

>From www.ghbinfo.com:

---[snip]---

On an almost daily basis the public is being subjected to media misinformation on
the dangers of GHB. The bias and ignorance of the media is evident by the
appellation "Great Bodily Harm" (GBH) applied to Gamma HydroxyButyrate. A
close inspection of the facts as revealed by modern scientific research however,
reveals that, contrary to most media and government "reports," GHB is not only
very safe, but extremely beneficial. So safe, in fact, that CARL has a standing
offer of a $10,000 reward for any scientifically documented permanent harm
caused to anyone by ingesting up to 50 grams of pure GHB alone! 

---[snip]---

Mostly when I've heard of someone hurting themself with GHB it has been in
conjunction with other chemicals, usually a depressant.  Mixing drugs is a 
good way generally to hrut oneself.  

This doesn't make it okay that this happened, though.  Anyone got the real
scoop about what happened at freedom?

-jon

tuesdays, when various members of the scratch picklz (usually) hold

phone book, and they usually have ads in the guardian/chronicle. If you go
there, you'll probably pick up some leads for other places.

I wish people wouldn't be allowed into the parties if all they were
interested in was the drugs. That's so fucking stupid. Have some respect
for yourself, your family and your friends. The pain you'll endure
when you OD is nothing compared to the pain that will never leave
those loved ones you leave behind.

The music is what I love and that's what it should be about. The joy I get
from the music is a million times more rewarding than any drug.

I think it's so sad that people slip away so young.. when they have so
much to look forward to. There is a whole world out there to explore. It's
not worth losing that opportunity for a night of drug use.

We should all look out for eachother and try to prevent senseless things
like this.

... Love the music, not the drugs.
		-Mystr-e

Hugz,

Byroni

I think it might be because we all like different speeds of music.
So if I like 180 beats per min and you are dancing
to the beat of a different drummer...say one that is
drumming at 120 beats per min then I might percieve
you as lagging because you are in a different time continuum 
or something like that and some one who likes 210 bpm
would see me as the lag. 

so we need a good cosmic dj to mix all our individual 
beats in to one texturally rich trac of peace and harmony

yanno i was there once, though.  every party i would go to i would 
take something.  now that has reversed, i hardly ever take anything 
and it surprises some folx.  so i don't know if i would go excluding 
those people, just the only thing we can really do as individuals is 
to stay in the positive zone and avoid the negative zone at all times.  

what are positive emotions?

desire
faith
love
sex
enthusiasm
romance
hope

what are negative emotions? (TO BE AVOIDED)

fear
jealousy
hatred
revenge
greed 
superstition
anger

why is this important?  because we want to positively reinforce these 
people so they will someday get out of their negative depressing world 
on their own.  the drug war is a bang your head against the wall deal, 
because it attempts to suppress the human nature of exploration.  

but if you see someone that doesn't look like they should drive, speak 
up.  

and if you see someone convulsing off ghb, help them.  if they die, 
mourn.  

then forget it.  cause they sealed their own fate.  it's not your 
problem.  

gotta go...-=dEEp=-

Well ladies and gentlemen, I am proud to announce that I'm back on the
list again.  When I unsubbed a whole two weeks ago, I had to deal with 14
units in school.  I've since dropped 8 of those units because I ended up
not having to take those classes.  As a result, I can now party.  It's
summer time and I'm going to live up to my capabilities.

It turned out that raving was like a drug and I was unable to go cold
turkey.  Instead I went to Sunset and Freedom soon after I unsubbed. 
(Had a dope ass time with Bryon and Rubi).  Therefore, I shall not be in
denial and I will go out as saying that I don't think I can ever stop
raving if I'm allowed to in the first place.

So anyways, just wanted to say hi to everyone and I can't wait to get
word of the killer parties and the killer ravers on this list.

Bye Bye

dErEk
"I don't do drugs; I am drugs."
		-Salvador Dali

This reminds me.  Have any of you been to a party on the East Coast?  NYC
for example.  They usually have big ass turn outs and there's *always* kids
laying in the middle of the dancefloor giving big 20-person E massages.
While I myself like to see kids happy, it bothers me when I'm about to
stomp on some whacked-out ravers head or arm, or other body part.  It's
especially frustrating when the kids are all in their K-Holes and drooling
on themselves not moving.  I say, if you're gonna get fucked up, get fucked
to the point where you *can* control yourself and not pass out on the floor
and embarass yourself later.  Or at least pass out away from the dancing
area.  Maybe that's what the chill-out rooms are really for.   Just a
thought.....  Love Toy

It has been brought to my attention by a concerned list participant that my
signature is pretty rude . . . I'm sorry if I offended anyone, but I did
let everyone know that I am a gabber girl, and I appreciate house music (I
even love some kinds! I do live in Chicago!), but that I will joke about
it.  It's in my nature to joke around. In real life, I can't even kill a
bug, so why would I purposely want to hurt anybody's feelings?

I just wanted to clear this up before I recieve anymore warnings.  I might
change my signature sometime in the very near future (if I can find
something more funny).

Love, Gabs*

>---[snip]---
>
>On an almost daily basis the public is being subjected to media
>misinformation on
>the dangers of GHB. The bias and ignorance of the media is evident by the
>appellation "Great Bodily Harm" (GBH) applied to Gamma HydroxyButyrate. A
>close inspection of the facts as revealed by modern scientific research
>however,
>reveals that, contrary to most media and government "reports," GHB is not only
>very safe, but extremely beneficial. So safe, in fact, that CARL has a
>standing
>offer of a $10,000 reward for any scientifically documented permanent harm
>caused to anyone by ingesting up to 50 grams of pure GHB alone!
>
>---[snip]---
>
>Mostly when I've heard of someone hurting themself with GHB it has been in
>conjunction with other chemicals, usually a depressant.  Mixing drugs is a
>good way generally to hrut oneself.
>
>This doesn't make it okay that this happened, though.  Anyone got the real
>scoop about what happened at freedom?
>

The problem certainly isn't isolated to mixing drugs.  GHB NEEDS proper
measurings otherwise it's all a gamble.  Often not the good one either.
For something that has so much risk involved, I don't see the joy of it.

Anyway I think people should steer clear of that and other substances.

should we."

>I dunno...is it curing or is it THC?  I say curing, anyone else?

Not necessaraly, brown weed usually has to travel a great distance. Most of
it probably comes from Central America although I've heard of shipments
from Africa getting busted on there way here. Anyways it takes along time
to get from the plant to your pipe, bong, joint, or whatever, and it gets
really dried out on the way. The curing can have something to do with it
too. When they harvest these fields of "grass" they just yank out the
plants and let them dry in the sun (very, very bad).



-Sean

Hi,
My partner (at FTT) and buddy Kevin and his friends were in a car right
infront of the jeep.... and saw the whole thing in the rear view mirror...
he told me that the jeep was travelling fast and went up the side of an
embankment and rolled over...
They slammed on their brakes and ran back to the jeep and started pulling
everyone out. He told me that only one of the guys there was badly hurt,
but the girl who was driving the jeep was hysterical. Kev was also put on
hold for about 10 minutes when he called 911 because the message kept
saying..."all operators are busy..please hold"...duh!!! Anyway, while some
of the crew were re-directing traffic... they tended to the kids while
waiting for the paramedics... and according to Kev... there were not in the
state of 'mind' to drive!! You can email Kev at email:kevon@funkytekno.com

Message-Id: <v01530501afe885486f8e@[38.12.123.217]>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Date: Tue, 8 Jul 1997 17:38:08 -0700
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: exodus@earthlink.net (Austin Woffington)
Subject: Kevin Saunderson in Lotus
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


I read LOTUS on the way home this weekend and one of the articals that
struck me was the interview with Kevin Reese Saunderson.  One of the
Detroit Techno inovators along with Juan Atkins and Derek May. If you have
the time I sugust you read it but the hilights for me.  He discusses
history of Detroit techno, the f@#ked up record distributors who but out
anything [music] for a buck, dancing as meditation and uplifting.
        He says "You know...most parties I've been to in America, there
like the worst parties I've ever been to in my life!...You get all these
damned people in a big party and all they do is stare.  There's no kind of
feeling- ... I went to a party in San Francisco recently [The Gathering]
that was one of the better ones I've done in America."

This makes me proud to party in this part of the country but ya know it's
not universal everywhere and this can only be done in America through
comunication, education, and spreading the vibe everywhere you go.

It has been said that SF has been the center point of many cultural and
sub-culture revolutions and we have the power, here in SF, to spread the
Love and Vibe around.  Make it be known that we are positive and that it is
possible for all to follow in the same footsteps everywhere.

Kevin also mentioned that the reason America doesn't have the vibe that
Europe has is because the attitude of the kids with their drugs in the
scene and that drugs DO make a difference in the vibe of a party.
"Honestly, in Europe, the main thing that helps people be a little bit more
spiritual, more into the music, is becasue of the drugs.  I know people
take drugs in America, but its different over there.  I've been to parties
[in Europe] where 90% of the people are on the same drug.  [They'll have]
30,000 peopleat a party and 25,000 will be on ecstacy.  In America, we have
more people on worse drugs and its harder to get 3 of 4 thousand people in
the same direction."

I haven't been every where KRS has been but I agree with his statement.  I
don't necesarlly advocate only exstacy use in our scene but if people would
lay off the drugs for a night and go for the purpose of the music or scene
would have more energy.

I don't have an answer myself just thoughts.  Read the artical or just make
your own opinion about the situation.  Take a step out a look at our scene
from the out side.  I see many young kids following blindly the older
generation and following the mainstream aspects of the scene : fashion,
money, power, drugs.  There is not much eduaction.  What happened to the
parties where the promoters or someone else would speak after the party and
explain the love the ravers had just experienced,  the e parties where only
e was taken and all who went just knew... Ya know?

"Let's party like the way we used to do it"  and then take it to another
level today through guidance, vibe, education, communication, and love.

peace!

  "I love the developement of  '\_0_    Austin Woffington
   our music.  How we've tried   (e)\,
   to develope, y' know?         /|     Exodus@earthlink.com
   It grows.  That's why every   \ \    awoffing@oboe.calpoly.edu
   day people come forward with  ~ ~
   new songs.  Music goes on forever."
                               -Bob Marley
