I've seen them, no experienced them, the last 7 times they have
performed in the bay area, and i gotta say, the experience that Crash
Worship provides is, well, very, very DEEP. They are both Frightening
and beautiful, sexy and ugly, mysterious yet fammiliar, Crash Worship
touch a very primal root in anyone who checks them out. Personally, and
please do not take this the wrong way, I have learned more about the
human condition at a Crash Worship performance than at any Rave. Any
thoughts? Comments?

just an observation.

-Pyro had written I had taken the easy way out of defining love...-

Is there an easy way out of love...I think not *8^)


    I can can recall in my travels a Dragon. An enourmous, flying,
firebreathing Dragon, who I saw faceless, without a home. Using my magical
powers I could open up, and look at his mind like a vision from a witches
couldren, and see his pain and passion. I saw him standing tall, towering
over the pine trees with his head almost reaching the clouds, and staring
down into a small patch of ground far below. He was staring at a rose. He
loved this rose more then anything could have loved ever before. He had
fought off pain, weariness, weeds, and demons, just to ever so 
infrequently catch a glimps of her beautiful red pedals or a scent of her 
wonderful sweet smell. He had traveled great distances, wounded, 
exhausted, awake, and in his dreams, just to feel that certain, mystical 
euphoria, that rumbling in his stomach, which only that one sweet rose could 
make him feel. And he then fell to the ground. He lost his strength and 
fell. Lying flat with his gigantic head landing in the one position where 
he would be forever staring directly at his love, he looked one more 
time...deeply...and saw a sweet, beautiful red rose, faceless, without a 
home.
    I slowly step away from the sleeping dragon, hoping that one day he 
will find a home again.




For those of you curious, this is a very short summary of a much larger 
piece of my writting. Love, (as I briefly wrote before.) is truely 
undefinable as it is grows on different people in different ways. We have 
all at one time in our lives know it and felt it. To deinfe it means to 
me that we would be taking away from it's mysticism. To express it 
rather, means to me that we are all sharing our experiences in it's joy. 


Love: the one thing on this planet that cannot be defined, yet can be 
infinately expressed :)


Stay Cool!

-Matt...the other one-

my favorite line of the night:

sunshine is singing (as the bourgeouis suit and tie crowd stand 
motionless in front of him - much to busy to dance, being aborbed with 
pontificating to their fawning female accessories the deeper implications of 
alcohol on the inner workings of their sex drive... but i digress)

*cuts out the beat for a second to bust out* "AND GET YOUR CUP _OFF_ of 
MY EQUIPMENT - HA!"

*drops the beat and the party goes nuts*

so the crowd was, well, not my blurryplurry fave, but dubtribe sounded 
sooooo damn good that it was still totally worth it...

Hi Everybody!!!
    Well thanks to a little help from aol, i found some 'raver' kiddos in
Reno! YAY! So we all hung out yesterday, their arn't many of them, they refer
to themselves as the family :o) they all wear this one lil glow in tha dark
necklace that has a duck on it. Kinda cute. They have a weeklie party on
Wednesdays with resident DJ Christope, and usually some other DJ's come out
(i think). Its 21+ but if your part of the family they don't care(i get to be
part of the family tonite!!) They have like 1 party a month, they get their
fliers done by this one girl who werks out at the Mustang Ranch. Its a big
change from the good ol SF area that im used to, but it'll hafta do for my
weeks and the weekends i can't come down. Theres one kid whos nick name is
after the guy "telly" in the movie "Kids", everybody calls him telly, and
i've yet to find out why(kinda scarry if you ask me, i mean isn't that the
guy from "kids" that gave hiv to all the virgins!!??!!) Ok welp, i still
hafta find a job, i'll see you all the 25, 26, and 27th!! Miss YA!!!!
Mad love and Hugs to all ya'll
P   L   U   R !

----- Begin Included Message -----
  
				EARTHGROOVE '97
				
		     A Benefit for Rainforest Action Network


When:  This Saturday Night! July 19th @ 8:30 PM

Where: The King St. Garage, SF. 174 King St, 1 block south of Townsend
between 
       2nd and 3rd streets. 

Performing:
 
* Los Angelitos - spicy hot funky latin grooves, a 10 piece band
  with a great horn section - winner of this years BAMMIE (Bay Area
  Music Award) for best Wold Music club band.

* DIG - Acid-jazz funk. Stand up bass player, horn section, a very cool band
that is
  signed to Sony records

* Supersauce - Ultra-funky 7 piece band. Great vocalist. Headlined at the San
  Francisco Haight St. Fair last 2 years. 

* DJ Monty and DJ F spinning down tempo and trip-hop grooves. 
   
Tickets: $10.00 available at the door or at BPM records, San Francisco

If you need directions or more information call the EarthGroove info 
line @ 415-905-8820. or check out http://www.geocites.com/RainForest/3682.

Please come out and "Get Funky for the Forest" :)

Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

just.jer wrote:
> 
> Ray Vonie wrote:
> 
> >         Im siting here, readimg the posts about the incredible
> > adventure and
> > amazing persaverence that your crew encountered through this ordeal,
> > and
> > I am filled with joy about the enthusiasm that you and your crew had
> > in
> > making this event happen.  It reminds me of my old school days... and
> > the type of stuff we did.
> >
> >         But now I read the above statement about this Massive Crews
> > screwing
> > with your event... and my whole atitude about the situation compleatly
> >
> > has changed.  If you know something for sure and you want to make it a
> >
> > mater of public record... THEN SAY IT.  But don't be looking for
> > scapegoats and starting desention without the information to back it
> > up.  Thats not right.  I seriously doubt that anyone messed with you
> > for
> > financial reasons.  that more or less eliminates any Massive
> > Promoters.
> > Chances are that someone had a personal grudge with you guys and
> > wanted
> > to mess up your party.. or whatever...  but lets not start saying that
> >
> > Big promoters are trying to ruin small promoters, cause that is RARELY
> >
> > EVER the case, and certainly NOT in the bay area.
> >
> >         Im realy pleased that your and your people persevered to make
> > the party
> > hapen against so many obsticles.  I also look forward to seeing many
> > positive events from your crew in the future.
> >
> >         So, Keep it positive, and Keep It REAL!
> >
> > Ray Vonie
> 
>    well I'm not saying any massive promoters did do that. but I can only
> assume, I don't really have any personal grudges with anyone, at least
> that I know of. Of course it could of been just some idiot that didn't
> like me, but then again in recent days I do know that a couple of the
> massive promoters have been bitching out small time promoters for
> throwing free parties the day of theirs. It's happening and leads me to
> assume, but I will never know the truth, so I won't point any fingers.
> The question still stands, regardless of my party or anyones party, why
> do massive promoters mess with ug promoters? it's a different crowd.
> 
	The Answer to your question is Realy a Matter of Perspective.  If you
reverse the question and ask it form the other side, it might sound
like; "Why do all these UG promoters throw free parties, Which can
happen on any night of the week (when there is nothing else going on) on
the night that we have been working on for months?"  You see, It is all
a matter of perspective.  And then you ask the question.... Whoos REALY
messing with who?    Hay its a free world and everyone can do anything
they want.  I am in no way saying that Either perspective is right, Nor
am I saying that either perspective is wrong.  What I am trying to say
is that we should RESPECT eachothers Place and Space.  Every Promoter in
this scene has their own visions to acomplish, and it certainly sucks
when you get cock-blocked from within Your own scene.  
	In adition, you need to understand, that NO-ONE wakes up in the morning
and decides to throw "massives".  Every massive promoter that i have
ever met (nad i have met a lot of them) has started of as an underground
promoter, and expanded their vision to larger events.  Most massive
promoters have earned their place, and to them it can be rather
offensive when UG promoters (most of which have not been around as long)
decide to throw a free party (which is rather easy to organize or
rescedual) on the same night that they have been working on for MANY
months and have a large invesment of time and resources behind.  
	Personaly, I think that free parties should take place on the
Weekdays.  In the past, that has always been the way it has been done. 
There are only so many Saturdays in the summer, but there are a lot more
weekdays.  Whats the difference when its a free party anyways?  It can
be on any night, why does it have to be on a saturday night?  You see
MASSIVES Have to be on Saturdays, Free UG's Can be on any night of the
week.  So when you get back to your original question of "why do massive
promoters mess with ug promoters" You realy need to reavaluate your
perspectives, and make sure youre not the one thats doing the messing.  
	And what the hell does it matter anyways, the bottom line is that its
all about KARMA.  Maybee some massive promoters deserve to have this
happen to them.  Or maybee you are writing your own Karma for the
future....  Your parties may get biger, and someday someone will throw a
freebee on your big night and rain on your parade.    The only save bet
is to Practice and be an example of the PLUR philosophy....  Its the
closes thing you can do to insure a happy life and secessfull endevours.

it all about:
>for the love of the scene.jer

Sorry that this was so long.

Keep it Real

Ray Vonie

Love is...

	What you feel after you have been whipped to the point that
your back is opened and bleeding, your throat is raw from screaming,
and the bonds that have been holding you up for the last hour are
released and you colapse on the ground at the feet of your owner
unable to do much more than twitch, your muscles exausted from
straining, and you look up into your owners' face and see they are
proud of you for enduring it for them.

	Marisa

>one thing I hate about email and chat is that ya never know exactly what
>people are trying to say, cause ya don't know the feeling behind what
>they're saying.

well, i'm new here, but thought i would share a few of my thoughts on how
impersonal e-mail and chat really is. it's almost as though all of the things
you type are put through some sort of filter. you could be e-mailing your
best friend, and later chat to a distant acquaintance and sound exactly the
same. plus the written english language  is overwhelming limited with the
noises we can develop with letters and punctuation it would be nearly
impossible to connect symbols to everything that comes from our mouths.
hopefully soon we'll be able to send e-mails that are recordings of our
voices, i think that would help. 


as for now.....i guess we'll have to make do with what we've got......
  -T

Ray Vonie wrote:

>         Personaly, I think that free parties should take place on the
> Weekdays.  In the past, that has always been the way it has been done.
> There are only so many Saturdays in the summer, but there are a lot more
> weekdays.  Whats the difference when its a free party anyways?  It can
> be on any night, why does it have to be on a saturday night?  You see
> MASSIVES Have to be on Saturdays, Free UG's Can be on any night of the
> week.  So when you get back to your original question of "why do massive
> promoters mess with ug promoters" You realy need to reavaluate your
> perspectives, and make sure youre not the one thats doing the messing.

Sorry, Ray - I just have to disagree with you here...
Most of the ravers I know prefer either massives *or* UGs, so I'm
betting that most of your crowd that would be there the night of your
massive would be there whether or not an UG was going on or not.  Same
with the folks that prefer underground parties - that's just their
preferance and massives don't appeal to them.

Then comes the question of money.  There have been several massives that
I would have liked to have gone to, but couldn't because I didn't have
the $20-$25 it costs to get in. This is especially true since I no
longer live with my parents and I'm living in one of the country's most
expensive cities etc, etc, etc.  At least the UGs provide a place for us
economically challenged ravers to go when we would still like to boogy
down! :)

One more thing - if things were your way, I would never ever be able to
attend an UG party because I work during the week and have to get up
early!  The only time I've ever been able to make it out to Mad was when
I was still unemployed!   I **LIVE** for my weekends, as I am sure many
of us do, and to have the *luxury* of *CHOICES* here in the Bay Area is
something I hope we always have.  

loving both massives AND undergrounds,
Amy

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org  Wed Jul 16 16:38:28 1997
Received: (from majordom@localhost)
	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) id QAA20688;
	Wed, 16 Jul 1997 16:38:28 -0700 (PDT)
Received: (from laura@localhost)
	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) id QAA20576
	for sfraves@hyperreal.org; Wed, 16 Jul 1997 16:38:16 -0700 (PDT)
Date: Wed, 16 Jul 1997 16:38:16 -0700 (PDT)
From: Laura La Gassa <laura@hyperreal.org>
Message-Id: <199707162338.QAA20576@hyperreal.org>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: "why are UGs on weekends?"
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Ray Vonie wrote:
>	Personaly, I think that free parties should take place on the
>Weekdays.  In the past, that has always been the way it has been done. 

While you are completely entitled to your opinion, I have a few questions.
First off, what past you are talking about?  There have always been
free parties on weekends.  Even when I was living back east and raving in
Brooklyn in '92.  Even when I started coming out to SF in '93.  Even
when I moved here in '94.

>There are only so many Saturdays in the summer, but there are a lot more
>weekdays.  Whats the difference when its a free party anyways?  It can
>be on any night, why does it have to be on a saturday night?  

Because, MANY of the people who help put on free UG parties have day jobs
and so can't stay up all night on a weeknight to set up, run, and break
down a rave.  Weekends are just as convenient for the UG party planners
as for the massive planners.  Also, because we have day jobs, we can't
always set up and throw a party on a Friday night either.

>You see
>MASSIVES Have to be on Saturdays, 

I certainly agree with this.  The amout of set-up and tear-down work
requires it, along with the fact that for a massive to attract enough
people to make back its investment it needs to be on a Saturday so it
can pull in a big enough crowd of people with day jobs to pay for it all.

>Free UG's Can be on any night of the
>week.  

I've been to a number of free UG parties that have had such intense set
up and tear-down production requirements that the above statement can not
be considered to be strictly true.  It can take up to 8 hours to set up
for a UG, 5 if there's a big crew and people really push hard.  It's difficult
to do this on, say, a Thursday, and have the party end at 6am or so and
get it torn down (another 4 hour+ job, especially if you count returning
sound equipment) and still make it to work.  Oh, and did I mention sleeping?

>So when you get back to your original question of "why do massive
>promoters mess with ug promoters" You realy need to reavaluate your
>perspectives, and make sure youre not the one thats doing the messing.  

I think there's a hint of paranoia in this statement.  In my 5 year+
experience, UG party planners don't pick dates and times just so they
can "mess with" massive promoters.  Dates are usually picked because that
is when a certain space becomes available, and it's either have the party
that Saturday or never have it at all.

I think if a massive promoter puts on a good enough party, has an
interesting enough set-up and DJ line up, and charges a fair price, then 
people will choose to go to it even if there is an alternate selection of 
free UGs to choose from.

And one more thing about "free" UG's.  They are never truly free, it's
just that in the case of the UG's the lighting, sound, and DJs donate
their time and skills and the the party planners choose to eat the remaining
production costs (e.g. space rental, security, refreshments, truck rental
to haul gear around, flyers, tickets...).

Laura

Sorry for the waste of bandwidth.  I just found this today.  I picked up
in Germany last summer.  It's short so just read.


	TOPIC:  Doing the dishes.

		There are four people named Everybody, Somebody,
		Anybody, & Nobody.  There was an important job that
		had to be done and Everyody was asked to do it.  
		Everybody was sure Somebody would do it.  Anybody
		could have done it, but Nobody did it.  Somebody got
		angry about that, because it was Everybody's job.
		Everybody thought that Anybody could do it but Nobody
		realized that Everybody wouldn't do it.  It ended up that
		Everybody blamed Somebody when Nobody did what
		Anybody could have done.


Thank you for your time.  Pretty cool huh?

C Ya

dErEk

From: gaberramos@juno.com (Gabriel R. Ramos)

Precedence: bulk

 "Why do all these UG promoters throw free parties, Which can
>happen on any night of the week (when there is nothing else going on) 
>on
>the night that we have been working on for months?"  You see, It is 
>all
>a matter of perspective.  And then you ask the question.... Whoos 
>REALY
>messing with who?   

1. people don't go out as much during the week.  why would you want to
spend your $$$ on having a free party if no one is going to go.   free
parties aren't free for the promoters.    it might not be as large an
undertaking as a massive but usually the people throwing free underground
parties are small groups.   massives take alot of work, but if you really
come from underground roots you know that UG promoters work hard to make
thier parties fat.

2. if you are throwing a massive and you are going to charge $20 or
whatever, you should have a party that is fat enough so that people will
go no matter what else is going down that same night.   massives and free
UG parties are not in the same league.  if people want to have a free
party thats cool.  more people can access rave/house/trance/D&B culture 
it is better for the scene.   remember people throw free parties because
they love to party.   not because they want to take $$ away from you.  
cause remember its not about $$.... right? 

  Most massive
>promoters have earned their place, and to them it can be rather
>offensive when UG promoters (most of which have not been around as 
>long)
>decide to throw a free party (which is rather easy to organize or
>rescedual) on the same night that they have been working on for MANY
>months and have a large invesment of time and resources behind.  
>

Do you really think that just because you have been throwing parties for
a long time you should exclusive rights to party on a particular date?  
diversity is good for the scene.    not everyone that wants to party on a
saturday night is down with the massive vibe.  and besides with the $$$
that massive promoters pay for superfat flyers and posters and crazy dj
lineups and lasers you guys should be attracting people.   do you want to
make money because people can only go to your party that nite (no other
choice).  or do you want to make money because your party is really fat. 
if I was throwing massives i would want people to go because of the sheer
fatness of the event not because there is nothing else to do.

> So when you get back to your original question of "why do 
>massive
>promoters mess with ug promoters" You realy need to reavaluate your
>perspectives, and make sure youre not the one thats doing the messing. 

giving people a chance to get down isn't messing with anyone.   its not
like selling dope on the corner where there is "turf".  no one owns
ravers. let them go where they want. 


sorry if this sounded confrontational but every one wants people to go to
their parties and  no one has a "right" to reserve any particular night
of the week.   I am not saying that any massive promoter is "messing"
with anyone.  I have no problems with massive promoters.  i think it is
cool that the bay area has people that can pull off really, really fat
parties.   

 but no one should ever call the cops on anyones party so that  more 
people come to theirs.  in my opinion anyone who does is nothing but a
money sucking judas goat.  but until it happens to me or others close to
me i would never accuse anyone of that.

at least i hope people around people around the bay are not like that.
are they?

peace to everybody

gabe

At 03:57 PM 7/16/97 -0700, you wrote:
>The latest flyer looks like it should be for a monster truck rally. :-)
>

Yeah, I don't think I've ever seen so many fonts on one page!  One of the
things that bugs me the most about big rave promotion is the overwhealming
presence of offensive graphic art.  Rave art used to be innovative and
exciting, but now it seems like only one in a hundred fliers shows any kind
of creativity.  That's kind of the way I've been feeling about raves in
general.  They've been pretty much the same for 8 years now.  Black lights,
flourescent posters, lasers, disco balls, trippy computer generated
visuals.  The music has continued to grow and change, but the rave
environment has remained largely the same.  I'd like to see some parties
with more of a concept behind them.  I'd like to see environments created
that are more than just expensive, flashy props.  It would be nice to see
some kind of fusion of raves with art installations, experimental film,
etc.  Has anyone seem Granular Synthesis?  They're an amazing video
performance group that was featured on the cover of this month's XLR8R,
spotlighting "visuals".  Funny thing is, they didn't actually talk about
Granular Synthesis at all in the actual artical.  Instead, they focused on
the "trippy computer visual" guys who've been doing the same thing for
years.  What's up with that?  When are we going to see something new in
this scene?

-Seth

Seth wrote:

> I'd like to see some parties with more of a concept behind them.  I'd like to see
> environments created that are more than just expensive, flashy props. 

I know that myself and others on this list feel the same way you do,
Seth.  Remember after Area 51 there was a whole discussion on turning a
party into something with a real theme with maybe literature and
lectures?  Your ideas about art installations and experimental film
sound cool too. Maybe someday soon that might become a reality.  I think
raves *are* evolving - for example there are more raves that have some
kind of opening ceremony and are spiritually themed (this is definately
an UG thing).  There are parties that happen outdoors on the beach or in
breathtaking paradise gardens (i.e. Tribal Future).  Then you have
Burning Man, which of course is not even a rave.  Come to think of it, I
think this scene has come quite aways - you just have to stop and think
about it for a few minutes...but I do kwow what you mean!

party on the beach this

I'm sensing a mini-flame war coming on (UGs VS massives), so I thought I'd
forward along some humor...
Your welcome :)

Here's some political definitions for y'all, in case you were
interested... 
*********************************

FEUDALISM
You have two cows. Your lord takes some of the milk.

PURE SOCIALISM
You have two cows. The government takes them and puts them in
a barn with everyone else's cows. You have to take care of all
the cows. The government gives you a glass of milk.

BUREAUCRATIC SOCIALISM
Your cows are cared for by ex-chicken farmers. You have to take
care of the chickens the  government took from the chicken farmers.
The government gives you as much milk and eggs as the regulation says
you should need.

FASCISM
You have two cows. The government takes both, hires you to take
care of them, and sells you the milk.

PURE COMMUNISM
You share two cows with your neighbors. You and your neighbors
bicker about who has the most "ability" and who has the most "need".
Meanwhile, no one works, no one gets any milk, and the cows drop dead
of starvation.

RUSSIAN COMMUNISM
You have two cows. You have to take care of them, but the government
takes all the milk. You steal back as much milk as you can and sell it
on the black market.

PERESTROIKA
You have two cows. You have to take care of them, but the Mafia
takes all the milk. You steal back as much milk as you can and
sell it on the "free" market.

CAMBODIAN COMMUNISM
You have two cows. The government takes both and shoots you.

DICTATORSHIP
You have two cows. The government takes both and drafts you.

PURE DEMOCRACY
You have two cows. Your neighbors decide who gets the milk.

REPRESENTATIVE DEMOCRACY
You have two cows. Your neighbors pick someone to tell you who
gets the milk.

BUREAUCRACY
You have two cows. At first the government regulates what you
can feed them and when you can milk them. Then it pays you not
to milk them. Then it takes both, shoots one, milks the other
and pours the milk down the drain. Then it requires you to
fill out forms accounting for the missing cows.

CAPITALISM
You don't have any cows. The bank won't lend you any money
to buy cows, because you don't have any cows.

PURE ANARCHY
You have two cows. Either you sell the milk at a fair price
or your neighbors try to take the cows and kill you.

ANARCHO-CAPITALISM
You have two cows. You sell one and buy a bull.

SURREALISM
You have two giraffes. The government requires you to take
harmonica lessons.

OLYMPICS-ISM You have two cows, one American, one Chinese.
With the help of shrilling violins and "state of the art"
montage photography, John Tesh narrates the moving tale of
how the American cow overcame the agony of growing up in a
suburb with (gasp) divorced parents, then mentions in passing
that the Chinese cow was beaten every day by a tyrannical farmer and
watched its parents butchered before its eyes. The American cow wins
the competition, severely spraining an udder in a gritty performance,
and gets a multi-million dollar contract to endorse Wheaties. The
Chinese cow is led out of the arena and shot by Chinese government
officials, though no one ever hears about it. McDonald's buys the meat
and serves it hot and fast at it's Beijing restaurant.

---------------------------------------------------------

>
>
>
>
>
>

Chris Porter
Customer Support
Explore Technologies
408-654-3846, 8-5 PST.

Yanno, 
It'd be great to have weekday parties, but FUCKIN SHIT some of us have to 
work.
How can we throw parties if we're doin 40+ hours during the week of work? 
Just curious.
And if outdoor parties only pull a certian amount of people, small amount 
compared to what massives draw, why should we be pushed out of the weekend?
Throwing free parties is not a crime, it shouldn't be dissed just because 
the promoters want to do something for the little jungleheadz or ravekids 
out there. Massives are NOT being hurt by outdoor parties. Kids who wanna 
go to huge warehouses and go to huve parties, do so. Kids who want to go 
to outdoor free parties and have a smaller party, do so. Sometimes they 
jump from one type to another -- ALOT of times they do.
But why should outdoor/free party promoters be threatened by massive 
party throwers? There's no reason, they have no right.
Yeah some of them have been around for a long time, that is proof that 
they're gonna be around for some time to come. But they don't RULE the 
scene. this is not a monopoly, it's a scene where everyone can contribute 
and shit. if kids wanna throw outdoor free parties the same night as a 
massive, it's their right to do so.
'nuff sed
and mad respekt to all.
lara

        sfraves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Subject: Re: oh yeah! UG & Massives?
In-Reply-To: <3.0.16.19970716171811.1937fe0a@exploretech.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.GSO.3.95.970716173511.23741A-100000@atari>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


Maybe if those massives kept up with massive props, massive ideas for
locations (oh gee, home base again), massive talent, and some massively
innovative ideas, they wouldn't be so concerned.

I was going to post a couple months ago how I thought it was a little
strange that massives were starting to suddenly acknowledge a large amount
of our UG DJs by having them spin.  Ironically, many of those UG DJ's that
were being acknowledged also throw UG parties.  Kinda like a corporate
buyout or something.  Neat way of guaranteeing that no larger UGs occur 
that night But then, better sense got the best of me, and I
wrote it off as another paranoid delusion.

I honestly think that Vlad's post started out as a almost joke, to show a
little perspective on Jer's post.  Let's just say it's not going to help
anyone if none of us trust each other.  There are some promoters who pull
some screwy stuff, and some use politics and some just suck.  When that
happens, we should make sure we know it's actually happening, and then go
ahead and call them on it.

Small parties are difficult to make money on, particularly free parties.
A well managed massive can make money, but only if draw works out.  I
don't know if I'd be able to maintain my integrity in the face of risking
losing $250,000... I almost feel I strengthen it by being involved in free
renegades every once in a while.  There's something almost purifying about
dragging a generator through half a mile of sand, then seeing people spin,
maybe even getting a chance to myself, and watching all these wonderful
people come out to join us and share in the nuttiness of it all.

It's up to the people going.  If they want to be part of the nameless
whorde and see the big names and do that then let em.  If they want to
gather in small groups risking their asses as a group, simply for the joy
of gathering and dancing, then let them.

In fact, a lot of these recent posts have been running around with the
idea of what money does to people, integrity, etc.  I've been thinking
about the best parties I've been to this year, and some were big parties
and some were small.

Just ask yourself this question:

Which promoter cares more about the vibe, the one with several thousand on
the line, or the one who KNOWS they're losing $500 to show some people a
good time.

Which DJ is gonna hookup with the crowd, the one that is hella stoked to
spin their favorite music for their friends and party, or the one who
negotiates with the promoter over whether they are really worth their
$1000 asking price?

Peace,
AndyW

At 4:43 PM -0700 7/16/97, Ethan Miller wrote:
>At 4:07 PM -0700 7/16/97, Amy Starkey wrote:
>
>>Ray Vonie wrote:
>>
>>>         Personaly, I think that free parties should take place on the
>>> Weekdays.  In the past, that has always been the way it has been done.
>>> There are only so many Saturdays in the summer, but there are a lot more
>>> weekdays.  Whats the difference when its a free party anyways?  It can
>>> be on any night, why does it have to be on a saturday night?  You see
>>> MASSIVES Have to be on Saturdays, Free UG's Can be on any night of the
>>> week.  So when you get back to your original question of "why do massive
>>> promoters mess with ug promoters" You realy need to reavaluate your
>>> perspectives, and make sure youre not the one thats doing the messing.

Vlad,

First off, history lesson: "In the past, there weren't $25 commercial
massives produced by greedy promoters, it was simply an artistic expression
created by a group of friends, bound by the music and the culture."

Second, it's been well talked about in the underground that *you* had
Spundae's Nation party shut down last year by flooding the police w/
complaints, etc, etc -- and they aren't even underground promoters -- it
was rumored that you were simply jealous that they were proceeding to have
a ma$$ive in SF before you could. I find that revolting.

You are and very well represent quite a bit of what's wrong with the
beautiful world wide community movement known as "rave" -- and it's your
shameless capitalistic tactics and values that are moving us closer to the
"1993" that we all want to forget, all over again. Infighting, promoters
calling the police on each other, and shameless commercialism is just what
got us there, and "that's you."

For you to suggest that groups producing free events as a passionate
artistic expression "get out of your way" so that you can fill your wallet
is the most offensive thing I've heard in quite some time. Just like (and
with) Ethan, I would *do my best* to ensure that there's always a *real*
alternative to anybody's commercial schwag-fests, including yours.

Finally, everyone, listen up!: If your party, big or small, gets busted, be
sure to "Think/Thank Vlad" -- based on his (and the communitys') earlier
innuendo, he's likely behind it.

Signed,

A passionate artist of the underground

From: "lara at vibe.org" <lara@vibe.org>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: what music means to me
Message-ID: <Pine.LNX.3.91.970716195856.30725K-100000@linux.announce.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Here're a couple of theories I worked out in my head at work (ahh 
brainless jobs that pay just enough to keep you from quitting are great 
for sitting around thinking up shit) as to why music moves us, and 
all of that shit. REad on.
	All our lives, from the very beginning, we have associated the 
sounds of music with pleasure. As infants, our mothers often sang to some 
of us. The soft, recognizable voice manipulated into a melodic reassuring 
tone brought us to a state of contentment and releived us of frustration 
of not being able to talk. As we grew older, tunes were played to 
celebrate joyous occasions, and we learned songs to make learning easier. 
Music hs brough a light to all of our lives, perhaps this is one of the 
reasons why it moves us.
	Music not only soothes my mind and soult, it heals my broken 
heart, brings out the best in me.. Lifts my spirits.. There's nothing 
like a wicked jungle track (hadda say jungle, i know, i suck) to bring my 
attitude up, a smile to my face, my self esteem begins to peek through 
and that surge of "fuck YEAH, life is DAMN good and you can't bring MY 
funky ass down even if ya TRIED" runs through me. Music keeps me sane.
	Bouncy or warped, rollin' or wicked, the basslines rattle and 
caress my mind and body, and breaks and samples rupture the flow like 
fuckin sunshine on a rainy day. On any day stick me in a windowless room 
with nothing in it. I guarantee I can entaertain myself -- I'll be 
groovin to beats in my mind. You can take my freedom, you can take my 
money, you can take my heart and break it mothafucka but you can't take 
music away from a person, coz you can't take my mind, and you can't TAKE 
my heart and soul -- and that's exactly where music comes from. 
	Maybe that's why I like music so much -- not coz it's always 
there for ya, which it is yanno.. But because it's NOT random sounds here 
and there. If you hear a sample, it's not there by accident, someone 
strategically placed it there for a reason -- to get a message across. 
Music is the artist's passions and dreams. Soemone's story. Here is an 
artist who is channeling their emotions into a sound they can express to 
anyone they please, sharing their passions with the world through melodic 
energy. And here are we, listeners, and not just receptors to random 
sound but to emotion in audio form. The artists -- our storytellers; the 
music -- the story; us -- the audience. The most beautiful way of 
communication and we can celebrate it whenever we damn well please. Pure 
emotion in fluid audio form. 
	Electronic music is just as beautiful and awesome as any other 
form of music, if not more so. Although it is composed with modern 
technology, it is still the expression of passion and emotion. The use of 
electronic devices does not devalue the music, correctly used it makes 
the possibilities in the realm of music endless -- there are no 
boundaries. Incredible, beautiful sounds can be made from a machine. It 
is the INGENUITY and PASSIOn of the ARTIST, *NOT* the instrument that 
makes beautiful music.
	Musicwill always be important and beautiful to me. It makes me 
move, brings tears to my eyes and a smile to my face. Inspires me. 
Touches me. It's a huge part of my life, always has been, always will. 
And if I could be so talented and I ever find the courage and 
determination, music would BE my life.

respekt,
lara

	for <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; Wed, 16 Jul 1997 19:26:07 -0700 (PDT)
Received: from upmajb06 ([204.95.110.89]) by upsmot04 (8.6.8.1/Configuration 4) with SMTP id TAA13257 for <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; Wed, 16 Jul 1997 19:27:45 -0700
Date: Thu, 17 Jul 97 02:22:30 UT
From: "Vanessa & Miccaela " <vbaird@msn.com>
Message-Id: <UPMAIL18.199707170224010575@msn.com>
To: "funkateers" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Subject: more on UGs and Massives
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Okay, this is me going off on my tangent:

If the majority of the people who go to massives are supposedly so degenerate 
that they screw up the vibe as much as (some) people say they do, then why let 
these people take over that part of the scene?

For instance, say you are one of these real ravers, you know, 
hardcore-old-skool-not-in-it-for-the-drugs-keep-it-underground types (which is 
not a bad thing to be, in fact it's a damn good thing to be).  Damn it, you 
love the scene so much that you can't stand to see "those people" fuck up a 
party, selling drugs, overdosing, freekin to trance music, or whatever it is 
that "they" do.  So how do you respond?  You just bitch about it and stop 
going to massives?

Well, sorry if this seems a little chickenshit to me.  But don't you think 
that it is your _responsibility_ as as _true_ raver to keep going to these 
parties, to set an example, to keep the vibe positive, and not surrender a 
whole part of the scene (the massive) to "those people?"  Just let them take 
it over?  What are you going to do when these folx start coming to UG parties 
(because, honey, eventually they will)?  Stop going to those?  Sit around at 
home listening to your Kraftwerk records bitching about how "those people" 
took over your scene?

I believe UG parties aren't necessarily better than massives--they're just 
different.  They're apples and oranges, baby.  But if you, like many others, 
believe that massives aren't as good as UG parties, that's fine, it's a 
somewhat valid viewpoint.  But if your reasoning behind that belief is that 
"those people" (discrimination and prejudice are beautiful things, are they 
not?) tend to overpopulate the massives, perhaps you'd better ask yourself how 
much of this is your own doing.  Look within yoself, chile.

Now, personally, I like massives.  Why?  Because they usually offer a lot of 
variety in music, talented djs and musicians, a whole lot of space & rooms, 
lots of cool party peoples, and they're usually popo/bust-free.  And because I 
refuse to let a couple bad seeds bother me too much.  If I tripped off every 
drug dealer, hoochie mama, and whoever else, I'd be angry as hell all the 
time.  In my (twisted) mind, these folx just aren't worth the time, effort, 
and emotion that goes into bitching about and avoiding them.  I just say, hey, 
fuck it, I'm in control of my own experience, and get my groove on regardless. 
 Besides, "they" sometimes aren't that bad if you take the time to get to know 
them.

Hmmm . . . isn't plUr about not dividing yourselves into US and THEM?  About 
getting to know and understand other types of people?  I think it is, but, 
I've never been a big fan of that plur thing, because it is too often said and 
oh so _rarely_ practiced, ya know.

Look up in the sky it's a bird it's a flame . . . sorry folx, just expressing 
myself, felt it needed to be done.  When I write posts like this, I want to 
make you think, not piss you off.  But sometimes getting people excited is the 
only way to do it.

So . . . If you're seriously angry after reading this, stop being so damned 
self-righteous!  Don't take yourself so seriously!  Besides, why the hell are 
you so worried about what I think anyway?  Instead of posting that flaming 
retort, go plant a tree or read a book, use that time for something more 
constructive.

Ahhh . . . does anyone else get all tense when they see 15+ posts w/ the same 
subject line . . . you know something's up, and you can just hope that it's 
not directed at you and won't piss you off too much if you read it . . . and 
you know that you _will_ read it, and probably contribute to it . . . no 
matter how much you said you wouldn't participate in flame threads when the 
last one erupted (Death at Origin, anyone?).

Hey, long live the flame war--I've learned a lot from some of those angry 
little posts.  It's good to have your values and viewpoints questioned and 
assaulted everyone once in a while--makes you think.  A flame a day keeps the 
ignorance away, maybe?

xoxo--Miccaela

At 02:22 AM 7/17/97 UT, Vanessa & Miccaela wrote:
>For instance, say you are one of these real ravers, you know, 
>hardcore-old-skool-not-in-it-for-the-drugs-keep-it-underground types
(which is 
>not a bad thing to be, in fact it's a damn good thing to be).  Damn it, you 
>love the scene so much that you can't stand to see "those people" fuck up a 
>party, selling drugs, overdosing, freekin to trance music, or whatever it is 
>that "they" do.  So how do you respond?  You just bitch about it and stop 
>going to massives?

I don't think anyone is saying (in the UG vs Massives thread) that people
who go to massives, per se, are the problem.  So far the debate has been
centered on party planners who see it as a competitive business rather than
something to do for fun.

> Well, sorry if this seems a little chickenshit to me.  But don't you think 
> that it is your _responsibility_ as as _true_ raver to keep going to these 
> parties, to set an example, to keep the vibe positive, and not surrender a 
> whole part of the scene (the massive) to "those people?"  Just let them
take 
> it over?  What are you going to do when these folx start coming to UG
parties 
> (because, honey, eventually they will)?  Stop going to those?

The reason I help throw UG's is *precisely* because that's the best way I
know how to "set an example".  To me, raving is all about the
Do-It-Yourself ethic - expressing yourself - being independent and creating
your own wealth of happiness rather than paying someone to dish it to you
on a silver platter.  I don't feel that's adequately communicated in a dark
100K warehouse with three strobes and four blacklights and Shredder
speakers and 3000 others.  Wandering around handing out glowsticks and
candy doesn't do it.

I'm not saying wonderful experiences can't be had at large parties; they
very often happen.  But without the grounding of the small parties, it's
very easy to mistake a big warehouse with booming speakers with a coliseum
rock concert.

I would much much much rather see 10 different parties with 500-1000 people
at each, than 1 big party with 10000 or 2 with 5000.  But your mileage may
vary, as they say...

	Brian


--=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--
"Why not?" - TL           brian@organic.com - hyperreal.org - apache.org

Ok.. a few have expressed interest in this topic...  This is the essay I 
wrote on it for English 1a last year..
While researching this I also found a report about the CIA 
giving Jack Kerouac and Carlo Marx LSD, and then observing them..
pretty crazy stuff

Gregery


          LSD and the CIA
    Everybody knows that LSD can be a very harmful drug.  Nobody knows 
this better than our government, but they still slipped large doses of 
this illicit drug to thousands of citizens.  MK-ULTRA was the code  name 
for the CIA's program derected at gaining control over human behavior 
through the use of chemical and biological materials.  Their goal was 
mass mind control.

The CIA used LSD at least as early as World War II and continued for 
many years after MK-ULTRA's publicly stated conclusion.  MK-ULTRA 
performed an undetermined number of bizarre and often grotesque 
experiments.  Many of these experiments were responsible for deaths and 
brain damage.  

Among the goals of the MK-ULTRA project were to develop the following.  
1. Substances which will promote illogical thinking and impulses to the 
point where the recipient would be discredited in public.  2. Materials 
to render the induction of hypnosis easier, substances which will 
produce 'pure' euphoria with no subsequent let-down.  3. Materials and 
psysical methods which will produce amnesia for events preceding and 
during their use.  4. Substances which alter personality structure in 
such a way that the tendency of the rercipient to become dependent upon 
another person is enhanced.  5. Substances which will lower the ambition 
and general working efficiency of men.  There are NOT noble goals, but 
not suprising considering the United States government.  The director of 
the CIA at the time of the founding of the MK-ULTRA program justified 
its notable unethical aspects with the rationale, "We are not Boy 
Scouts."  The MK-ULTRA program officially ran from 1853 to 1964, when it 
was renamed to MK-SEARCH and continued until 1973.

The CIA victimized certain groups of people who were unable to resist: 
prisoners, mental patients, foreigners, the terminally ill, sexual 
deviants, ethnic minorities.  One project took place at the Addiction 
Research Center of the US Public Health Service Hospital in Lexington, 
Kentucky.  Lexington was a place where heroin addicts could go to shake 
a habit, and although it was officially a penitentiary, all the inmates 
were referred to as "patients."  CIA documents describe experiments 
conducted at Lexington in which certain patients - nearly all black 
inmates- were given LSD for more than 75 consecutive days.  In order to 
overcome tolerance to the hallucinogen, double, triple, and quadruple 
doses were administered.  It is no wonder that Lexington had a return 
rate of 90 percent.

Tests were not limited to only helpless victims.  The CIA did massive 
internal testing.  Such testing in November 1953 resulted in death.  On 
the second day of a three day CIA retreat, the after-dinner cocktails 
were spiked with LSD.  After the cocktails, the guests were informed of 
what they had ingested.  Dr. Frank Olson, and army scientist who 
specialized in biological warfare research, had never taken LSD before, 
and slid into a deep depression.  In the weeks that followed, he 
developed some very strange behavior.  It was concluded that Dr. Olson 
was in "a psychotic state with delusions of persecution"  that had been 
"crystallized by the LSD experience."  Arrangements were made to move 
him to a CIA sanitorium.  On his last  night before leaving, he was in a 
New York hotel room with a  CIA agent assigned to watch him.  In the 
early morning, the scientist
plunged head-first through a closed window to his death ten floors 
below.  Olson's apparent suicide caused CIA security to be drastically 
tightened.  An elaborate cover-up erased clues to the actual 
ciircumstances leading to his death.  Olson's widow was eventually given 
a government pension, but the truth was not revealed for twenty years.

There is quite a bit of evidence that the CIA used LSD in the 60s to try 
to keep the youth from creating uncontrollable political movements.  The 
use of LSD among young people in the U.S. reached a peak in the late 
1960's , shortly after the CIA initiated a series of covert operations 
designed to disrupt, discredit, and neutralize the New Left.  Ronald 
Stark was a leading distributor of LSD in the late 60s.  The CIA has 
never admitted that he was an operative, but in 1979 he was  standing 
trial in Italy for armed banditry.  He was released after investigators 
found "an impressive series of scrupulously enumerated proofs" that 
Stark had worked for the CIA "from 1960 onward."  Tim Scully, chief of 
Stark's major LSD-brewing outfit, believed that Stark was employed by  
an American intelligence agency that wanted to see more psychedelic 
drugs on the street.  John Lennon once said, "We must remember to thank 
the CIA and the army for LSD.  THey invented LSD to control people and 
what it did was give us freedom."

Then there was operation "Midnight Climax."  The CIA employed a group of 
drug-addicted prostitutes in san francisco.  They sent them to bars to 
try to lure men back to an apartment.  While at the bar the prostitute 
was to slip acid into the man's drink.  Back at the apartment CIA 
researchers sipped martinis and observed the scientific action from 
behind two way mirrors.  The official purpose of this was to test the 
exploitation of sex for espionage purposes.

LSD was not the most potent drug investigated by the intelligence and 
military agencies.  Nor dfid they limit their research to drugs.  
Hypnosis, electronic brain implants, microwave transmissions, and 
parapsychology also were researched.  John Marks, and author on the 
subject, readilyh acknowledges that the researchers "probaly" planted 
electrodes in the brains of men.  Marks points out that the electrode 
experiments "went far beyond giving monkeys orgasms," one of the 
researchers' early achievements.

Psychiatrist Ewen Cameron recieved CIA funding to test a procedure he 
called "depatterning."  This technique, Cameron explained when he 
applied for his CIA grant, involved the "breaking down of ongoing 
patterns of the patient's behavior by the means of particualarly intense 
electroshocks," in addition to LSD.  Some of his subjects suffered brain 
damage and other debilitations.  One sued the government and won an 
out-of-court settlement in 1988.

Sometime around 1973 when the founder of MK-ULTRA was to retire, he 
ordered the majority of secret MK-ULTRA documents destroyed sue to "a 
burgeoning paper problem."  Amond the disposed materials were all 
existing copies of a classified CIA manual titled "LSD: Some 
un-psychedelic iimplications."  Their exists today no on-paper evidence 
that MK-ULTRA was either a conspiracy to unleash remote-controlled 
lethal human robots or to emasculate an entire generaltion by 
oversaturating it with a mind-frying drug.  But MK-ULTRA was very real 
and the danger of a secret government program to control the thoughts of 
its citizens needs no elaboration.


______________________________________________________

friends and significant others, or if they've just made poor decisions.  
Once you love someone, you *always* love.  

There's no such thing as conditional love.

Hey Everyone on SFRaves! I Love you and I missed you!! Did you miss me?
Of course you did! Well, I don't know how each and everyone of you feel
about me and I know that some of you people (especially the ones who
never met me) don't like me, but thats okay. Someone must like me!

Well, I missed you guys and I am so sorry if anyone emailed me and I
never got back to you. I just went away from my computer for 2 weeks and
when I came back there were 500 something messages and I was like no
way. I just kept putting off dowloading them all. Then one day Paula
(that beautiful and happy girl) gave me the idea of deleting my email
and then remaking it. All the 1455 email messages were deleted along
wiht my email. Then I got my email name back and now i just downloaded
105 messages for today.

I don't know what some posts have been about. I have heard stories about
stuff and I have some things I would like to say about certain things:

1) Wonderland. Even though sooo many things went wrong that night, (the
map point, the voicemail, the bust up, the after party confusion, the
projecter, the gum etc.) I think that it was an experience that i will
never forget. Not only did it show that the SF Scene has a STRONG sense
of unity, but also it made me realize jsut how many ravers I care about
and how many care about me and my friends. I thought that the night was
spiritualy uplifting and special. Remember its not about the party at
all its about US and the one thing that seperates us from the rest of
today's society. UNITY!! Yes, todays society lacks it greatly. Some how
ravers have still been able to keep it strogn between them and
Wonderland proved that in every way possible!

2) Death at Origin - I don't know the details, but I am sorry about what
happend. Its sad. My heart goes out to anyone who knew the person who
died.

3) Cops - They suck!!!!! They are assholes and no matter what peope say
about them doing their jobs, they are still jerks. Now, I take that back
I know a few cops who are damn decent people and are fair and
considerate. Those are the ones who should be comended for a job well
done.

Thats all I have to say about that.

Well I am gonna begin posting once more. Also, Amanda or Dustin will onw
of you please email me. Sorry to use SFRaves as a pager, but I neeeeed
to get ahold of one of you. Preferably Dustin. 

Lotsa Luv,
Paul*E*Wog

MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: Re: UGs & Massives
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

At first I planned in writing this long post on this Massive n UG
thread. But after some thinking well, I just dont honestly know where
I stand on this. I see a lot of good points on both sides. But anyway,
here we go

I dont really think that there is anything wrong with throwing a free
party the same night as a massive, just dont shout the word out as
much. A free party has less of a problem getting the word out anyway so
its not necessary to really push the flyers. Let the parties that cost
money to put on do that. Yes I know "free" parties cost too but they
dont need to get that money back. Massives do. So for instance if
something like a FMR happened the same night as a massive I dont think
anyone would care because Full Moons are so low key anyway. 

I come from a long line of entrapanuers (All the way back to the
Mayflower!), so I give total props to anyone who makes their living
doing something they love. For me, thats the ONLY way to live. You have
to bring home the bacon somehow, might as well be something you enjoy.
But should a big budget, 20-10 dollar party take priority over a free
one? Raves started out free I thought. Its not that I dont like
massives, on the contrary, I love em! And having only worked one massive
personally, I totally appreciate the work that goes into them, and it
would suck to have someone throw a free party the night of your massive.
But I think its really a matter of economics. If people are in fact
choosing to go to an outdoor, less glamorous, free party as opposed to
the brighter, louder massive that costs, that should tell you something!
That should tell you something about what people really want. As the
saying goes "The people make the party."

It seems everything costs money these days. People are always trying to
nickel n dime you any way they can. So to me, the word "Free" just
keeps sounding better and better. Think about how much noise people make
over a $1 bottle of water, and how much they love free stuff. When
something is free, its more than just zero cost, its saying "no
strings attached" or "giving you this is my reward". And in todays
society, doesnt that sound refreshing?

OOPS! Well, I guess this did turn out to be pretty long! :P

-=Pengo=-

greetings from across space =)

im writing this message to let everyone know that the Ion Exchange is 
open. we are located at 765 cedar st suite 102 in Santa Cruz. (408)454.9976
we carry psychedelic trance/ trance/ jungle vinyl, CDs, and mixtapes - 
Spacetribe and Silver Palm Leaf clothing.
***			
four months ago, five friends opened this 
record store in santa cruz. these four months have brought their share of 
trials, stresses, obstacles, adventures, and experience. during some 
rather adverse times, when faced with situations neither of us have 
ever encountered in their lives, some of us decided to leave. at this 
point it wasnt evident wether we could continue or not.

a core of us remained to hold together the vision. that core, 
along with a few new members, has spent the last two weeks restructuring 
the framework of the business. among many things, this includes a much 
larger selection of music.

each one of us has concluded that this vision is much to awsome to let go 
of, and to the best of our abilites we intend to continue to channel this 
very beautiful and powerful music - which has literally changed our lives 
- into downtown santa cruz. 


the Ions.

</BSP>

only can be depicted in your most happiest of all dreams-that is love, for what 
else would make you act so cRaZy?!?!?!?

emotions that flow through me but for the sake of others who can not bear to hear 
more i shall end with this..."my love runs deep, (deeper than any root in any 
garden) never will i plow my roots from your heart-just so long as you let mine 
take hold. care for me & i shall never hurt you.  i give to you my heart, body, 
mind and soul.  you have given me your heart, so i give you mine-i keep it with

Listen.

Why I am getting involved in this, well, i don't really know.  but im
typing, so i guess you're reading, we've got a little somethin goin here...

Yanno, when this thread first started, I made an assumption based upon
something i heard secondhand.  And what have i been trying to do all these
years?  Never make assumptions based upon what you have heard, Tony!  What
an idiot I was!  Oh my god.  I assumed that massive promoters were trying
to bust up @spire so they could put more $ in their pockets.  Vlad is right
in saying that this might not be true.

However...

If it IS true, whoever is doing that is making some really bad business
practices.  Worried that they're not going to have enough.  That's what it
would be if it were a massive promoter calling the cops on an UG party.
Why bad business?  Because if they were throwing truly good parties where
you pay $15 or $20 and get a good party in exchange, why would you have to
worry about 3 or 400 kids not attending your shindig?  Worried about that
extra ten thousand dollars?  why?  you're not guaranteed to get those
people.  they may not want to pay $25.  but if you are producing a good
product, people will buy it like hotcakes.  trust me.  people will start
sayin, ' i wanna go to this massive cause they throw good parties.'  basics
and the gathering has that reputation.  some others are getting there, they
just need to tune their engines a bit.

you see, there is one thing that maybe the massive people might want to
understand about the UG people.  I defintely am more of an UG person,
myself, so I don't know if I would accurately portray the point of view of
a massive promoter, but i might try after i portray the UG side.

UG people, in their extreme, from my observations, are very unmotivated by
money and glitz.  They may not want to be around the big crowd.  So
everyone with their belief systems being different, the average person in
America today when they are confronted by something that attacks their
belief system gets pretty defensive.  We have not been taught as a society
to look at the other person's point of view first.  We have been taught
that we have to be right.  Think about it.  why does everyone have to prove
they are right till they're blue in the face?

but anyway, we have these 2 schools of thought here the UG's are saying
screw the massives (on the extreme) and the massives are saying the UG's
should courteously move aside whenever the massive people want to throw a
party and just understand they need the money.

as rodney king would say, "can't we all get along here?"  i mean really.
there has to be some happy medium.  unless you guys like fighting on email.


personally i think that the scene is big enough now to support a lot of
different events going on in one night.  if you people started spending
your energy on working together instead of pointing fingers at each other
(by the way, when you point the finger at someone, 3 fingers are pointing
back toward YOU) imagine how much better things could be!  I always have
trouble believing that anyone would be just motivated to sit there and
bicker.

well that's enough.  im just throwing this out there. im convinced that if
there were one of those valued brain to MIDI interfaces, like we could all
just plug into each others brains and understand what each others points of
views are and start working together instead of against each other.

but there is something almost as good as a brain to MIDI interface.

Listening.

Try it.

It's not easy.

Sometimes we think we're listening but we're not.

Everyone has a right to their opinion.

There are some valid points in this thread, it would be good to read the
whole thing again.

dEEp

At 7:08 AM -0000 07/17/1997, Pengo wrote:

>It seems everything costs money these days. People are always trying to
>nickel n dime you any way they can. So to me, the word "Free" just
>keeps sounding better and better. Think about how much noise people make
>over a $1 bottle of water, and how much they love free stuff. When
>something is free, its more than just zero cost, its saying "no
>strings attached" or "giving you this is my reward". And in todays
>society, doesnt that sound refreshing?
>
>OOPS! Well, I guess this did turn out to be pretty long! :P

>-=Pengo=-

its funny that you come from a long line of entrepeneurs, cause i'm startin
a long line of entrepeneurs. my goal in life is to help other people
achieve their goals.

one thing about the word 'free'.  it is good to have free things offered to
people.  to a point.  sometimes when free stuff is just given and given and
given, people stop appreciating it.  at free parties there should be some
type of exchange encouraged.  passing around the trash bags.

but not expecting, though, becausxe the best type of  giving is
unconditional.  and sometimes it's nice to come to a party, and just party
and not have to worry about anything.  but just kep in mind that when you
come to a party, someone spent their time and money so YOU could have a
good time.  so just respect it.

free but respect.

ok guys.... the only reason I brought up the thing about ug's and
massives is to understand it better.... it's understood now and I don't
wanna see you guys flaming vlad for what he said... he was just trying
to help me understand what's going on. and he has. I don't think he
meant to say what he said the way you guys took it. he's a cool guy and
throws some of the best massives in the scene. FGE was talked about by
so so many of the ug kids as a really good massive, and I've heard a lot
of good about him as a person in the underground scene. I just don't
wanna get too deep into a flame war. Discusion is one thing, but going
off is something else. I'm not saying that I agree or disagree in what
his origional post said that started this whole thing, but I think it's
time to either take this into personal one on one email, or drop the
subject in it's entirty... all in all I really really really don't want
a war between ug and massives, there are reasons there are both and
there is good and bad in both. People have a preferance and that's why
different kinds of parties are important in the scene as a whole. We are
the rave scene.... we love the music, the people, and the vibe. We try
to melt it together as a whole, but it's impossible. Our diversity is
what makes our scene unique and special.

peace and love to all you yoots!
jer - @spire

One of few good posts I have read concerning the whole Vlad thing. Personally
I chose not to get involved originally, because I didn't feel i needed to be
a part of a flaming match, I'm just not that way. The real point is that we
all have different values and views on life and all the subjects contained in
it, and we need to be considerate of others' views as well, if we are to
obtain the peace we so long for. So, my only statement is this: Look
objectively, because it's the only way we know how; Listen wholeheartedly, as
we have learned that it is the best way, and; Respond considerately, because
otherwise we are not creating, but destroying, which is the complete opposite
of what we are trying to accomplish....
Just a thought, from me to you....


PLUR


Pyro

P.S. This is NOT directed at anyone personally, since I didn't read but two
or three of the posts involved, just some insight to all that are out
there....

---Vanessa & Miccaela  <vbaird@msn.com> wrote:

> 
> Well, sorry if this seems a little chickenshit to me.  But don't you
think 
> that it is your _responsibility_ as as _true_ raver to keep going to
these 
> parties, to set an example, to keep the vibe positive, and not
surrender a 
> whole part of the scene (the massive) to "those people?" 

NO!!

i think it is our responsibility to offer these kids an ALTERNATIVE. 
A safer, more creative environment.  If we just kept going to ALL the
massives then there would be no alternatives for people to go to.  I
mean sure there are some massives that i would go to....but these are
becoming more and more scarse.

the underground is here for a reason.....or reasons.

Here are some.

--selfless and creative promoters that are willing to GIVE to and not
just take from the party goers.
--provide a cheap and safe place for people to go
--promote values and individuality
--promote "other" types of music that u don't always get to hear at
massives.  i.e. techno, trance, trip-hop, d&b....etc.etc.

The UG's are here for a reason and us "old-skoolers" support them for
a reason.  Hell...personally i've been through the cycle of massives
and UG's and i mostly go to UG's for a reason...i feel more
comfortable there.  I went to massives for a long time...but they just
can't offer me what the UG can.  I think that is why a LOT of "old and
new skoolers" end up in the UG.

okay...enough rambling.

8)`
dan

Date: Thu, 17 Jul 1997 11:45:44 -0700 (PDT)
From: Rob Rayle <robertr@autodesk.com>
Message-Id: <199707171845.LAA09717@klaatu.autodesk.com>
To: VENTR4TH@aol.com, joel457@ix.netcom.com
Subject: Re: just say no to ghb
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

>If you have a choice of E or GHB...why not the E?

	I'm totally straight-edge, myself. But I have to say that I
would choose to use GHB before E. Why? Because GHB is a substance that
already occurs naturally in the body, and is fully metabolized by the
body when ingested (it doesn't leave any toxic residues hanging around).
It is also legal, which means that it is possible to get pure GHB of
known strength (you have to get it mail-order from overseas). 

	If I were to decide to use this (which isn't really likely),
I'd certainly experiment with dosages in the safety of my home before
attempting this at any kind of party. And I would get religious about
not mixing it with anything - not even a joint or a beer. Of course,
that's easy for me since I don't use those things anyway.

	Even pure GHB has this weird property that it acts like a
stimulant in low dosages, a downer in higher dosages, and knocks you out
at even higher dosages. I'd probably look for the stimulant effect mostly,
but sometimes you just want to take a nap and that pounding bass makes
it really tough ...

To love is to suffer. To avoid suffering one must not love, but then one
suffers from not loving. Therefore, to love is to suffer, not to love is to
suffer, to suffer is to suffer. To be happy is to love, to be happy then is
to suffer but suffering makes one unhappy, therefore to be unhappy one must
love or love to suffer or suffer from too much happiness.

				-Woody Allen, "Love and Death"

Adam

MagicArts Corporation

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org  Thu Jul 17 14:44:02 1997

	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) id OAA26128;
	Thu, 17 Jul 1997 14:44:02 -0700 (PDT)

	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) with ESMTP id OAA26090
	for <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; Thu, 17 Jul 1997 14:43:50 -0700 (PDT)
Received: from ala-ca19-08.ix.netcom.com (starve@ala-ca19-08.ix.netcom.com [205.187.212.40]) by netcommunications.net (10.1/8.7.3) with SMTP id OAA14926 for <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; Thu, 17 Jul 1997 14:50:15 -0700 (PDT)
Date: Thu, 17 Jul 1997 14:50:15 -0700 (PDT)
Message-Id: <199707172150.OAA14926@netcommunications.net>
X-Sender: leslie@netcommunications.net
X-Mailer: Windows Eudora Version 2.1.1
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Leslie Ayres <leslie@netcommunications.net>
Subject: UGs, Massives & Church
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

I had a dream last night that there was a town with ten churches, and the
Baptist Church, which was small and had little money, got upset because the
Catholic Church was spending so much on its new building that some of the
parishoners actually wanted to go to Mass to experience the opulence, which
would mean even less money in the collection bowls.  

Then the Christian Scientists anonymously called the building inspector to
report a possible hazard in the Unitarian Church, and when he came and shut
down the church on Sunday morning, they were there handing out directions to
the Reading Room.  

Meanwhile, the Seventh Day Adventists were issuing press releases with
unsubstantiated and unverified rumors about how the Methodists were
underdeclaring the money received in the collection each week, and the Jews
were holding a meeting to see if they could keep the Buddhists next door
from chanting during Friday night services, because the noise disturbed them.

Thankfully, I woke up, knowing that dream was ridiculous because truly
spiritual people would never behave that way, because they know that all
beliefs deserve respect, and that if you don't respect other's right to
believe differently than you, then you're missing the point.

Then I checked my email, and what a nightmare.  The church of the massive
was being attacked through innuendo by the church of the free-beach-party,
and the church of the old-school-underground was being attacked by the
church of the massive, and the church of the old-school-underground
retaliated with some "he-said-she-said" accusations of its own.

As a "churchgoer" who considers herself a contributing member of all of
these "religions," this is so disturbing.

This is yet another example of how divisiveness hurts our scene as a whole.
Certainly we can't expect that all promoters have the same motivations and
priorities.  But, in a scene that theoretically is based on a shared love of
music and dance and the coming-together of like-minded people, it would seem
obvious that learning to respectfully work together is a priority of the
highest order.

Nobody "owns" this scene.  Nobody has a "right" to stop someone else from
throwing a party on any particular night.  And *nobody* has a right to make
slanderous and libelous statements in a public forum without substantiating
them.  

How about let's leave the rumor and innuendo to the tabloids, and act like
responsible and admirable adults, giving others the respect that we would
like to receive from them.  

If anyone thinks that the only way they can "succeed" is to try to get
someone else to "fail" ... or that they can only be right by making someone
else wrong... then think again.  

The real way to success is by *being* successful, by behaving in an honest
and pure way, by considering the effect of your actions on others, and by
being the kind of person who is worthy of respect.  Show that you are worthy
of being treated with respect through every action, every word, every deed.

The way to have other promoters respect your party is by respecting them,
and respecting their events.  When conflicts arise, talk about it, try to
work it out.  Sabotage is never acceptable, whether it's by anonymous phone
calls complaining about a "competitor's" party, or by posting
unsubstantiated rumors on SFRaves. 

If you're a promoter in this community, then you have a responsibility to
set and maintain high standards of behavior.  We all win when those
standards are met, and we all lose when petty ego-driven issues get in the
way.  

Optimistically,

Leslie

i don't know if you have been really reading the posts or just looking at
the subject and getting pissed off.  people are not bitching about people
overdosing or selling dope, or going to massives to pick up girls or
whatever.   people are not stereotyping "those people" at massives. 
people are just pissed of that vlad thinks that people should not throw
free parties on the same night as massives out of some kind of "respect"
that vlad thinks many massive promoters have earned in HIS mind.  try to
figure out the root of the discussion before you go off on a tanget that
has nothing to do with the discussion.   no one is trying to stereotype
people.  what we are talking about is wether people should have to step
aside every saturday nite so some fat cat can make a killing charging $25
+bass charges just because no one can go to any other kind of party that
nite.   people are not dissing the crowd at massives.

did you read the posts or were you just getting pissed of because you saw
the same subject over and over?

and another thing why is it chickenshit to not want to hand over $ 20 to
get into a party if there is nothing there for you.  I will pay $20 for a
party that is fat enough but why should someone keep going to massives if
they are not having fun?    You talk about it like it is our
responsibility to "keep going to these parties".  well some of us never
went to that many massives in the first place.  living in santa cruz i
was lucky. i could go to full moon every month so i didn't feel like in
order to have a good time i had to hand over my$20 just like all the
other 5000 people in line.   some people like the more intimate vibe that
little parties offer.   no one is "responsible" for giving someone else
money if they don't want to.     thats what we are talking about. choice.
 according to vlad people should not have the choice to go to a free
party on a saturday night.  do you think that is right?

peace
gabe

Message-Id: <UPMAIL18.199707180019040183@msn.com>
To: "funkateers" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Subject: last comment on UGs and Massives
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Okay, after this I'll shut up.

1.  Yes, I was wayyyyy off topic w/ my post.  Going off on my tangent.  But I 
don't think there would have been _as much_ fuss about what Ray said if he 
said "UG parties shouldn't be on the same night as each other" or if he was a 
UG promoter.  I think a lot of people on this list have a lot of hostility 
towards massives and I wanted to address that.  If you look at the posts 
you'll notice that they say things like "if I was a UG promoter I'd make sure 
my events were on the same days as massives so only the true ravers would come 
out" or "I just don't like to go to massives."  If this doesn't reflect bad 
feelings towards massives, I don't know what does.  I felt something had to be 
said about that, even if I was off topic.

2.  You don't have to go to massives.  You don't have to pay $20 to go to a 
party you don't think you can have fun at.  You don't have to do anything.  
But don't complain about the way massives are if you aren't even trying to 
make them any better.  And don't complain when "those people" that go to 
massives start coming to the UG parties.  Because they will.  And then you 
won't have to pay $3 to go to a UG party you don't think you can have fun at.  
You can stay at home.

3.  Back on the topic--I was appalled at some of the posts directed at Ray.  
Regardless of how true anything you said might have been, you had no business 
posting it to the list.  Those posts merely expressing disagreement were fine, 
but personal attacks don't belong on the list.  Act your age.


But that's just my opinion, and I'm pretty damn sure not everyone agrees.  I 
could be wrong.  Go figure.  I'll shut up and let this thread die now.

xoxo--Miccaela

I know that we are all lost in the nostalgia of the old days, but don't you
think that 5 years is long enough to carry on a thread. 

Every possible argument about undergrounds vs. massives has been stated,
there are no winners, there are no losers, go where you want to go. Why
can't we all just get along?

I'm over it...

toodles... we'll do lunch!

-demon

The acorns of the headache tree
Are planted nighly
In the peripheral groves
Above the keyholes

- a few words by jack tripper after a night of trippin' too hard

Five listings for Friday and eight for Saturday (not including the weeklies)
makes for a good selection.  Actually, a lot of them are outside of
San Francisco, or feature new DJs or different kinds of music, so there's
a lot of diversity too.  Being a cancer, I might stop by the Top Friday night,
and The Mist on Saturday is a great chance to see the Technics really 
being worked.


                                THE SFR CALENDAR
                                       
    http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar/gencal.cgi
