OK, I want to ask a question that is extreamly opinionated. It has to do with
drugs, But I am not sure whether or not it has been discussed. Is this
subject matter something we can all discuss without letting it blossom into
something it is not.. I don't want to create a flame war and i dont want to
cause tension. 
Is this question I have worth asking??
If someone goes to a rave for the first time and does drugs, will this
persons concept of what raving is all about be drug related? What about
someone who goes to their first party sober, then tries drugs at a party, or
someone who never does do drugs...


Jonathan

>If someone goes to a rave for the first time and does drugs, will this
>persons concept of what raving is all about be drug related? What about
>someone who goes to their first party sober, then tries drugs at a party, or
>someone who never does do drugs...

I dont think this is a question that can be answered.  Like you said, it is a very opinionated question.

I really think it depends on the person.  I was sober at my first party.  I didnt even know what E was.  I personally dont think Raves are all about Drugs. However, no matter what anybody says, Drugs are a very important part of the Rave.  Always have been, always will be.  Its up to the individual to decide if Drugs are important to them, and if they need drugs to have fun at the Rave.

-M

OK, I want to ask a question that is extreamly opinionated. It has to do with
drugs, But I am not sure whether or not it has been discussed. Is this
subject matter something we can all discuss without letting it blossom into
something it is not.. I don't want to create a flame war and i dont want to
cause tension. 
Is this question I have worth asking??
If someone goes to a rave for the first time and does drugs, will this
persons concept of what raving is all about be drug related? What about
someone who goes to their first party sober, then tries drugs at a party, or
someone who never does do drugs...


Jonathan

Subject: Re: nrr: how to get rid of a headache
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Cause of Head aches::::::: The main reason that people get headaches is from
presure that is built up from blood in the brain. Your brain is being
squeezed and it doesn't like that. So your brain complains and that is your
headache. Headaches are caused from many different things but the most common
is stress. Usually if you have been under a lot of stress or even minor
stress, your neck muscles tighten up. When this happens the blood flow that
moves into the head is constricted by the muscles in your neck, so that the
blood flows in but it is hard for it to flow out.

How to get rid of Headaches::::::: Yes you can take Tylenol and all of those
other legal drugs out there but they are not to good for you (in high
amounts). ThE bESt WAy tO gET rId Of hEaD ~AcHhES~ the natural way is this
-------------> Relax, breath in seven counts and breath out seven counts. you
lay down on flat surface (preferably a bed) stomach down (If you are on a bed
let your head hang off the end). Now you need a freind to massage your neck
on the sides and on the top. Gentily pull the head from the shoulders. This
will loosen the neck muscles. But when you gentily pull DO NOT add any
torque, you could hurt the person. Continue to message the back side of the
neck. Soon your neck muscles will be loose and your headache will have
vanished. This also works for stiff necks too. Hope I helped. Party on
                    O r i o n

>I've done this with CC#7 (volume).  Most sequencers will let you draw
>in the continuous controller info.    

CC#7 is what i meant by "hammering the volume controller". However,
dealing with these as MIDI notes (as the LA Audio MIDI gate permits)
would be a lot easier to control, and more musical (as opposed to
computical)... TOo bad it's so f'ing expensive. Drawing in the
controllers seems like a real pain -- hard to edit, hard to change the
timing, etc.

hello all-

>Is this question I have worth asking??

what question isn't worth asking? =)

>If someone goes to a rave for the first time and does drugs, will this
>persons concept of what raving is all about be drug related? What about
>someone who goes to their first party sober, then tries drugs at a party, or
>someone who never does do drugs...

i went to my first party not exactly sober, and in my experience <flame
fodder>i have had a different experience from those i know that started
partying sober</flame fodder>.  was it better?  i don't know.. you only get
to go to your first party once, so i have nothing to compare against!!!

in my not so humble opinion, i think it totally depends on the person as to
what is better.  knowing myself well, i think that the life changing
experience i had at my first party might not have happened had artificial
chemicals not been coursing through my brain.  THAT WAS ME, AND THAT MIGHT
OR MIGHT NOT BE RIGHT FOR SOMEONE ELSE!!!

my concept of raving, though, has not been all drug related.  after my
initial six months, i started going sober, and started having a very
different, but welcome, experience.  i started working on the parties,
giving water to everybody, doing that parental thing that i do well.

that's my opinion.  enjoy!!!

love to you all-

matt =)

Hey all I thought I would just put in my 2 cents to these posts.
my first party I was sober and the party was not that great. It was at
one step beyond about 5 years ago the sound and DJ's were not so hot
but it was after all my first "Rave" and it was new exciting and fresh
the scene had been here for about 2 years before I started going to
parties. then I went to the second gatherings new years party at
vallejo fair grounds Took some mind bending chemicals and had a great
time, not that going sober the other times were not good. It is just
with the chemicals the music sounds louder and tripEr and you feel
real happy and unhibited you are and as well as everyone else very
open. Fortunatelly I had a ravEE partner and me and her had a bonding
experience. So to sum it up I think you can have just as good of a
time sober or Bent. I think a person should ExpEriEnce a party in
altered states at least once to get the other side of the fence
feeling.

Macadio

jondabomb@aol.com posed the question...

>If someone goes to a rave for the first time and does drugs, will this
>persons concept of what raving is all about be drug related? What about
>someone who goes to their first party sober, then tries drugs at a party, or
>someone who never does do drugs...

hmm... let's start with the people i have brought to parties through the
years. a lot of them went with the intention to experience both the partying
itself _and_ the drugs. let's all be honest here, to most people the rave
scene _is_ a drug scene. and a lot of first-timers go just because of this.
and yes, if your first party is a party where you do drugs, they will become
very important when you party in the future.
oh yeah, my friends. a lot of them very average joes and lindas with no
real interest in techno music. they had heard my stories, they had seen me
all pimped-out and ready to go. and they wanted to find out what it was like.
so i brought them along. and i'm sure a lot of people on this list went to
their first party without being total technoheads. and if you're not totally
into the music, and it's your first party so you don't know too many people,
the drugs might be a really "good" way to get into the whole thing.
unfortunately, this might lead to the person being totally bored at a party
if they don't do drugs. and in the case of a few of my friends, if the party
is $10, they won't go unless they have at least $50. "it's not that i can't
have fun without drugs, it's just that...well, you know" is the kind of
argument they'll come up with. pretty sad isn't it?

i hope no one took offense to my post. =)

*kisses*
jonas THE BOOZEBOY ;)

di-vine - what tarzan use to get from de tree to de hut.

"gee, if it's in a book, it _has_ to be true." - millhouse

"was that badass? it was badass. did i care? i did not."

"it's not easy being cool." - jerry springer

>>Sounds like us Sfraves music-makers ought to get together sometime
>>and jam, or talk, or share, or whatever.
>
> I'd be into this!
>

>Ok, so where do we meet and when?

Well...thats a good question.  Do we actually want to meet and Jam, or just swap tapes, or talk, or hang out?   I'm down with all of the above.  Where do all the SFR SynthHeads live?  I'm in San Jose.

    

>CC#7 is what i meant by "hammering the volume controller". However,
>dealing with these as MIDI notes (as the LA Audio MIDI gate permits)
>would be a lot easier to control, and more musical (as opposed to
>computical)... TOo bad it's so f'ing expensive. Drawing in the
>controllers seems like a real pain -- hard to edit, hard to change the
>timing, etc.

Ya, it can get quite time consuming.  Another way I have done this is with a Gate.  I have a Yamaha ProMix 01 that has a built in Compressor.  The compressor sucks, but the Gate works well.  Lets say you want to do the transforming on a sound thats coming in on mixer channel 1.  You set the gate to effect the audio on channel 1.  You can set another mixer audio channel to open and close the gate.  So what I've done is sent a sound (doesnt matter what type of sound, but preferable a short perc. sound like a closed hi-hat) to mixer channel 2 with the channel volume down.  If the hi-hat sound is sequenced 16th notes, you'll get a 16th note gate on channle 1.......  

hmm.. hopefully that makes sence.  I'm having a hard time 'splaining things today for some reason....

-M

From: Phil Lockwood <leaf@ted.net>

        San FranDisco Ravers List <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Subject: Re: music making discussion 
In-Reply-To: <199707282129.OAA19163@netcom21.netcom.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.SOL.3.91.970728154353.12609F-100000@uh>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


how 'bout using a compressor/noise gate?  many gates have a key - a 
controller that allows the signal to flow through.  this can be triggered 
with an external source, such as a drum machine or a synth...  another
possibility is routing a square wave lfo to the vca gain or the vcf 
cutoff.

-phil



On Mon, 28 Jul 1997, Niels P. Mayer wrote:

> 
> >>PS: any of y'all have an opinion on MIDI gear i could use to do that
> >>stuttering type gating (transforming) your hear on a lot of classic
> >>techno. Yeah, I could try hammering the volume controller on my EMU
> >>EIIIxp but that's not particularly easy to sequence.
> 
> >I've done this with CC#7 (volume).  Most sequencers will let you draw
> >in the continuous controller info.    
> 
> CC#7 is what i meant by "hammering the volume controller". However,
> dealing with these as MIDI notes (as the LA Audio MIDI gate permits)
> would be a lot easier to control, and more musical (as opposed to
> computical)... TOo bad it's so f'ing expensive. Drawing in the
> controllers seems like a real pain -- hard to edit, hard to change the
> timing, etc.
> 
> =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Precedence: bulk

actually this is not really an opinion needed, but they are very
welcome.  

this is more me expressing my opinion.  and it's right along the same
lines as Jondabombathon's post.  

i am not a drugless raver, but many of you have been shocked to find out
that i have gone through many a rave night sober.  recently i've even
gotten invites and with a sort of comment toward the end like 'you're
gonna take e too right?'  and i have sort of more or less made the
decision that i am bored with psychedelics because i've been using them
since i was 16 and now i am going to be 30 this year.  

but i've made the sort of committment to some people that are throwing
house parties over the next 60 days and some of these committments to
stay and do drugs i may have to reevaluate.  

some of you may be reading this and i hope you don't take this
personally as an attack on you personally.  but i am in a totally
different space than a lot of you partygoers right now.  i am in
business for myself at least part of the time, and when i go to a rave
and stay all night without sleep, it is hard enough to recover and get
back into 9-5 mode so i usually spend all day sunday sleeping.  

but there is just this amazing push i receive from some people to make
sure that i make it to the next after party or whatever is happening
right quick soon.  but i get bored easily and what i have discovered is
a new drug anyway.  

that drug is called achievement.  

making a difference in someone else's life.  
helping people.
giving complements.
telling someone they're the coolest.  

i would like some of you to try this drug.  it's addicting.  in the long
run, it's more addicting than ecstacy.  

some of you that i observe at ravEs take a lot of ecstacy, well, too
much ecstacy.  

ecstacy is a doorway to pure love.  it's meant to be opened, observed
and shut.  

because otherwise you let out all the heat you've saved up in your
spirit.  you know?  like when someone leaves the freezer door open and
then you come back and everything is melted?  especially the ice cream! 
=[  

i hope i didn't offend anyone.  but i hope that some of you that invite
me to a house party will understand that i am a very INFREQUENT heavy
drug user.  except for pot.  i don't consider that a real heavy drug. 
it's like drinking coffee in my eyes.  

any opionions are welcome.  

love, 

dEEp

From: Phil Lockwood <leaf@ted.net>

Subject: Re: dubplates?
In-Reply-To: <199707282314.AA28770@crl.crl.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.SOL.3.91.970728163339.12609G-100000@uh>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


i hear the terms dubplates and acetates used interchangeably (i'm sure 
some kind soul will correct me if i'm wrong)...  dubplates are single 
pressings of a track onto a cheaper medium (acetate?), which tends to 
have lower quality and wears out much more rapidly than a regular vinyl 
record.  it's typically around $50 - $60 to press an acetate - it gives 
the dj a chance to drop his/her track into the mix and see how it sounds and 
what sort of crowd response it generates...

btw, does anyone have any places in the bay area that they would 
recommend for pressing acetates?

thanks,
Phil


> what is a dubplate? is this a limited edition vinyl pressing only available
> to djs?
> 
>

             <Pine.SOL.3.91.970728154353.12609F-100000@uh> 
Date: Mon, 28 Jul 97 16:40:09 -0700
From: "Niels P. Mayer" <mayer@netcom.com>

Precedence: bulk


>how 'bout using a compressor/noise gate?  many gates have a key - a 
>controller that allows the signal to flow through.  this can be triggered 
>with an external source, such as a drum machine or a synth...  another
>possibility is routing a square wave lfo to the vca gain or the vcf 
>cutoff.

The compressor/gate option is why I mentioned the Presonus DCP-8 and
the LA Audio MIDI gate. The latter seems the best solution because,
rather than having to produce a sound to generate a gate, it lets you
gate one of the channels direclty via a midi note-on/off. (Seems
like a waste to tie up one instrument just to generate a gate).

I was kind of wondering if anybody knew of a gate like the LA Audio
MIDI gate that was significantly cheaper than the $1200.00 they're 
charging. For one, i don't really need 16 channels of
automation/gating. I mentioned the presonus DCP-8 because it's cheaper
and it has only 8 channels and it also has 8 channels of MIDI
controlled compression, mixing, etc. However, it's not clear whether
you can do gating via MIDI notes directly, as opposed to using an
external trigger (which implies slinging some wires around -- something
i want to avoid).

=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
==      Niels Mayer -- http://www.eit.com/~mayer -- mayer@netcom.com       ==
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

I think you're smart and I appreciate you expressing your current
situation. 

I'm kinda at the same point. Where I am choosy about when I use
and when I do not use. But mr green jeans is always enviting me down to
the turquoise lounge for an old soul massage. :) I can never deny myself
this pleasure. :)

I've noticed a few of my friends get really into E and it just ruins
things. Basically they NEED it to have fun after a while and don't even
know whose spinning or whose promoting the party, etc. When you need to
take a hit of E to have a good time there's a problem. The vibe alone is
mind blowing in our scene. I went down to la recently and was surprised at
how different things are. The VIBE sucks and the people/crowd is so much
different. THere was no one smiling, sharing things, or even talking to
one another. It seemed like people were trying SO hard to act fucked up
and didn't take the time to relax and absorb the music and surroundings.
Our scene is so wonderful.. and my experience in LA makes it even more
beautiful and meaningful....


Byroni

ps. "Mind if I smoke?"..... "Care if I die?"

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org  Mon Jul 28 17:27:13 1997
Received: (from majordom@localhost)
	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) id RAA06264;
	Mon, 28 Jul 1997 17:27:13 -0700 (PDT)
Received: from atari.saturn5.com (atari.saturn5.com [204.253.162.254])
	by hyperreal.org (8.8.5/8.8.5) with ESMTP id RAA06255
	for <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; Mon, 28 Jul 1997 17:27:09 -0700 (PDT)
Received: (from simitzis@localhost)
          by atari.saturn5.com (8.8.6/8.8.4)
	  id RAA19122; Mon, 28 Jul 1997 17:27:06 -0700 (PDT)
Date: Mon, 28 Jul 1997 17:27:06 -0700 (PDT)
Message-Id: <199707290027.RAA19122@atari.saturn5.com>
From: Steve Simitzis <steve@saturn5.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: Crash Worship at the Troc
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


Well this isn't exactly rave related but...

I had a *blast* at Crash Worship at the Troc last night; it fully
satisified my need for death, destruction, fake blood, and naked
people for the next couple of weeks. The band opened their set by
thrusting themselves into the crowd of happy club goers, whilst the
guitarist sat on stage, squealing away. They had huge Mardi Gras style
masks and large torches, with people blowing kerosene to create huge
burst of flames from their mouths.

The show alternated between an apocalyptic tribal ritual (very Burning
Man-esque), a death punk show, and a display of pure, primal erotic
energy, with red wine, grapes, and syrup poured all over it to cool
things down (or at the very least, to make things nice and
sticky). For the periods of time that band decided to stay on stage,
they had a powerful presence with their many drums, a long bass
guitar-like thing, several keyboards, and a singer that would spend
his time screaming into three pitch shifters. The rest of the cast
consisted of topless dancers, cheerleaders, and people who would just
randomly squirt fluids onto the audience.

I didn't catch them at the rave they played at, but chances are, it was
probably a bad mix. I think the Troc crowd is a little more tolerant of
a band who actively tries to set the audience and the venue on fire. >:)

Anyway, it was my first Crash Worship show after having known about
them for years, and I must have more. And I'm all rev'ed up for
Burning Man now.

Steve

-- 
Steve Simitzis |   steve@saturn5.com   ||   steve@eff.org   | "Hup!" - R. Crumb

On Mon, 28 Jul 1997, Steve Simitzis wrote:

> I didn't catch them at the rave they played at, but chances are, it was
> probably a bad mix. I think the Troc crowd is a little more tolerant of
> a band who actively tries to set the audience and the venue on fire. >:)

	There was a time when and a place when raves had this energy as
well. There still are, just few and far far between. I am not trying to be
an old grumpy type, but, I miss being able to find raves that as the music
builds, you start dancing harder and then the music plateaus, but for some
reason, something keeps propelling you to dance harder, to squish in with
the crowd and stomp around, and as you dance harder, the person just in
front of you and to your left dances harder too, and it makes you dance
harder and then they dance harder (but they couldn't SEE you dance harder,
so what caused his/her back to arch just a little more and his/her legs
hit the ground just a little harder, and his/her arms find a new way to
move throw the air? All this open room to dance, who needs it ;) Give me a
packed room where everyone is shoulder to shoulder and everyone's sweat
gets smeared all over everyone else....

dave

> move throw the air? All this open room to dance, who needs it ;) Give me a
> packed room where everyone is shoulder to shoulder and everyone's sweat

>

Seriously, brother, and interestingly enough, to connect this to the club
vs rave discussion from a bit back, I have been finding that this
proximity of bodies all going fucking mental together has been more common
at clubs lately than at underground events.  The one example that
blatantly stands out in my mind was the Carl Cox set at 1015 at the end of
May.  Hundreds of people with no space around them bumping and grinding
each other, but not macking, and unable to muster any thoughts past THIS
DUDE IS GOING NUTS I AM GOING NUTS ALL THESE PEOPLE AROUND ME ARE GOING
OFF THE FUCKING NUTCASE.

OK, real sorry about that.

PAX,
MAX

i can say with certainty that true love was the best party i've ever been
to. the vibe was just amazing.
the wedding was truly cool. i will definetely remeber last saturday night
for the rest of my life. 
i usually spend lots of time dancing at parties, but saturday i found myself
running around
trying to meet all the smiling faces i could. i'd list names of people i
met/hung out with here,
but as bad as my name memory is, it would take all day.
i met a few first time ravers, all of whom just seemed blown away by the
incredible vibe. what a perfect party
to go to for your first.
all the dj's rocked. whoever's sound that was in the dungeon, i just want to
give you props, that's
some of the deepest bass i've ever felt. 
thanx to amber and everyone at her pre-party for making my first time
spinning out such a good
experience.

hugz,
jelo

Hey there!
I think it totally depends on the person.  The parties that I've gone 
to, well have honestly not been too sober, but I am definately planning 
on it for about a month at least.  The drug thing runs in my 
family...lots of f*ck ups but I'm planning on revolutionizing that 
because my brain...wait, what was I saying?  Just kidding, is fine, a 
little sore from True Love.  Originally, to be honest I do kind of think 
that parties would be related to abuse if you do drugs at them for your 
first party  (makes no sense whatsoever, its purely becasue I'm tired 
though, I swear), but people do need to experience them sober...because 
they are fun that way tooooo!
Love Always,
Danny

P*H*A*Ty!!!!!A*M*A*Z*I*N*G!!!!
I had a BLAST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! oh my god, I have soooo much to 
say!!! I just can't find words on how to express myself :)

Lets start by saying: thanks.
THANK YOU all soooooo much for coming and supporting us and being
there to share Amanda and Duston's Unity and being there to celebrate
with us and just THANKS THANKS THANKS!! without any of you, none
of this would have happened. really! :)

Amanda and Duston, I LOVE YOU GUYZ!!!!!!! I miss ya guyz so much 
and its only been a few days! :) (Amanda call me ASAP!) :)

Everyone else in da krew, THANK YOU GUYZ!!!!!!!! I love ya allzs
{*huggles*}

On to the review :))))))))
I'm still glowing in happyness and joy from this weekend. I will have
to say, it was one of the most amazing nights of my life. I am thankful
that I got to be part of it, and I shared the moment with all of you :)

Beautiful SETUP!!!!!!!!!! the decorations where amazing!! did everyone
see the colored E's downstairs? ;) (yay me!) the posters where
wonderful! the fluffy clouds... what ever happened to them!? the stars
the hearts, everything! :)

EVERYONE was beautiful! I met so many people, I can't remember any of
their names ;o) {*blush*} but I DO remember your faces :) I will not
forget them :) you are all wonderful :)

the SOUND SYSTEM downstairs was MONSTROUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Anakin
was spinning some HELLA NICE STUFF!!! earlier while we were setting up
it was NICE!!!!!!!! Anakin you rule! :P

speaking of Djs and how phat they were! 
I didn't really get to listen/dance much to the stuff downstairs.. it
was definitely like a compeltely different party going on down there!!
I'm sure it was BOMB!! specially with the sound system they had! ;)
but Upstairs....... WWOOOOOOOOWWWWWW!!!!!!!!! the vibe was soooo phat
it was hard to dance ;) I just HAD to talk to everyone :) I swear no one
left the party without getting a hug or a smile from me... I hope at
least :) 

Special Thanks to DEEPFOG!!! for doing the OrganicGreenWeirdJuice stuff
and being incharge of playing the stuff for da ceremony :))))))))
Deepfog, is da bomb everyone :) oh and THANKS for playing that song
for Duston! :) the party would not have been complete without U2's WITH
OR WITHOUT you :))))))) Duston, that one was for ya ;)

SPecial Thanks to UNCLE NOAH for helping me out with JulieMae's Bday
Present-Song :) NeverENding Story DanceRemix TORE da place down!!!!!
*EVERYONE* was dancing!!!!! I relive that moment every time I hear the
song :)))))))))))))))))))))))) Julie mae, I hope you had a good time :)
and HappyBirthday! I love yas!!!! {*Huggles*}

gewd, soooooo many more people!!!! gewd, we are just going to have to
throw a THANK YOU party!!! :))))))) hehehe..... ok ok, I know...I'm
dreamin':)

I would like to say Hellos to everyone I met, (of da list, send me an
email if you remember me :))))) I was the guy that was dressed up in da
suit and the tie and the big shoeS! :P) everyone email me!!!! yay!!!!!

I'm so happy :)
I gotta go tho ;)
but I love ya allzs :) and once again I THANK you all for coming...

[*BIG HUGE HUGS*]
:o)--- :o)--- :o)---
PabloPop

On Mon, 28 Jul 1997, *byroni* wrote:

> one another. It seemed like people were trying SO hard to act fucked up
> and didn't take the time to relax and absorb the music and surroundings.
> Our scene is so wonderful.. and my experience in LA makes it even more
> beautiful and meaningful....
> 

Hello.

Just wanted to jump to the defense of my hometown. Elevation,
Moontribe, Organic, and a hell of a lot of other parties in the last year
or so have been damn good.  Me personally, I find it upsetting sometimes
that we (the list) bash so much on LA.  Those parties are some of the best
I have attended, and I should hope you're not bagging on those.

Parties for the most part seem a tad more hardcore (esp. the UGs) in terms
of how die hard the people going are.  Parties tend to start later and end
later (noon sometimes even further).

If you came to SF, and went to a crappy corporate event, or a bad party in
general, I should hope you wouldn't go back to LA saying the scene here
sucks.... and I'd love to see us return the favor.

Trust me, they DO go off down there from time to time.

Just be prepared to dance more and talk less...

Peace,
AndyW

this was a party that reminded me about why i love to rave. i've gone
through some times when i've questioned our scene and when i've questioned
myself for being in it. i won't ever question that again. true love
completely restored my faith and overwhelming love for raving and ravers. it

my new friends, and all those i didn't get a chance to talk to - you all
made my night incredible, you all made the vibe unforgettable - and i love
you all very much. special thanks to amanda and dustin (and congrats!), for
a night i'm sure none of us will soon forget.

To all the customers, friends, and family thet I have met while working 
at the most laidback, awesome, and friend-oriented coffee shop in the 
world,
  This morning I was woken up by my pager which I had left next to my 
brain just in case I had to work this morning.  Yup,  It was my last, 
very last shift at City Espresso in Santa Clara.  This job was the ONLY 
job I have ever thoroughly enjoyed.  Not because the work was easy but 
you, the customers and friends I met by working here made it fun and 
enjoyable for everyone.  
   Another groovy thing  (I know the word is entirely overused these 
days  :)  I would not give any credit to anyone but the City crew and 
the big Ol' Grumpy raver Matt  :), Andy W, Keri, Lee, Alex, Jen, Jay, 
Vlad, Allegra,Noah...You guys all kick ass!!! All you great faces that 
come to Slow Roasted every wednesday,,well you kick bootie too!  I'm 
going to miss all of you, well I'll still probably be in every day until 
I get my act together but who knows how long that will be  :)   
Michelle, I can no longer flirt with her for hours on end and all the 
othe cool customers that don't gimme shit from spittin' in their drinks  
J/k  :) I've never done that and have never been tempted to because 
1)bad karma, 2)I respect my cutomers too much, even Miles 3)It is gross, 
4)tips are usually lower  :)  5) Do unto others as you'd want done to 
you!!!!! (I think that is kinda how it goes)
I will never forget any of you beautiful people.  Stay Rad, loving and 
willing to take anyone with a smile into your arms.

I Love You All Very Much and please don't be afraid to stay in touch  :)

 Always, Forever,
 Danny Picard

email)  poobear@hotmail.com

In-Reply-To: <Pine.GSO.3.96.970728203521.20633B-100000@atari>

Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk


As a member of the SoCal scene I feel a need to pipe up here too.  There 
are a lot of really good, quality events down here.  You just have to be 
in the know to find them on a consistent basis.  SoCal Raves does a 
really good job of helping people find the good stuff.  

I agree, Moontribes are fun, Elevation2 was possibly the best rave I've 
ever been to (and I'm spinning at Elevation3... :D  ), the house parties 
and BBQs have all been so fully of positive energy and happiness that 
it's hard to describe.

Yeah, so maybe that Go Ventures party you went to wasn't so great.  Or 
maybe you wound up at Blitzkreig with me when it got busted up at like 
midnight, but for every event that gets busted or is too corporate, there 
are four or five others that might even be so UG as to have only 15-20 
people, but they went off like crazy.

I think that in SoCal there is a real quantity issue.  There are _so_ 
many events to choose from that it's hard to know what's going to be good 
or not.

Now, here's where I let my Socialist agenda poke through:
The real problem I see in SoCal is that there are a lot of 
business-persons in the scene.  Too many promoters looking to turn a 
profit, too many DJs looking to turn a profit, and too many possibly 
non-rave friendly space-owners looking to turn a profit.  And this 
results in kids running around desperate to be at 'the right party' at 
'the right location' and you wind up with problems like Double Hit Mickey 
and stuff like that.  I feel that the SF scene has an edge here because I 
see more promoters, DJs and ravers who are in it for the music and the 
vibe.  I'm not syaing this doesn't exist in SoCal... it's just masked 
under a lot of profit-hunting.  Chances are you'll get a flyer for some 
massive corporate thing and not for a backyard BBQ, ya know what I mean?

So that's my take on SoCal vs. SF.  Is one better than the other?  Nope.  
It's just different. :)

Well I helped setup and I feel as if I had been with all the planning sence
the beggining.  Well all I can say is that when I arrived at the space at
2:00p.m. saturday I knew the minute I walked in there the party awas going
to go off.  It was soo incrediably positive, and the energy, coming not
only
from the people there, but the building as well, into the top floor was
soooo
overwhelming it almost knocked me over.  I knew  we were not going to
have any major problems with the party getting broken up.  When the party
first got
started and people started showing up, the energy from 2:00p.m. just
escalated all night long, the a huge escalater with no ending.  I was
outside most of the night working the door,  anyone who I offened at the
party by being really rude by having people move out of the door way I am
so sorry, I hope you can understand where I was coming from.  Anyway after
the police said turn off the music at, WHAT TIME,  6:30a.m., hello the
party was
almost over, but he didn't break up the party we just had to turn off all
the
music.  Well after about an hour the music got started going agian, and
everyone was really happy.  I talked with a lot of poeple there and all I
heard from everyone was, This is an incredible party, it has changed my
life forever,  it made me see myself in a new way,  anyway I am sure you
all get the point.  Again I am sooo glad everyone came out in support for
Amanda and Dustin, you know I love you GUYS WAY WAY TOO MUCH!!!!, as well
for the Kalediscope CrEw.  I hope everyone keeps the vibe from this party
GOING and GOING to every party you may attented to.    Thanks again 

Eric
250 blow pop boy!!!!

	Anyway, for those cool people who are heading to JUGGERNAUT this
weekend, we're making the road trip up to set up the Pure Acid Mixtapes
booth, as the lineup looks like something I can't pass up!

	If you've never heard of us, we are rave vendors with the largest
selection of DJ mixtapes in the U.S. (over 500 tapes to choose from). 
We also sell $1 glowsticks, cool toy necklaces, and lots of other neat-o
stuff!  If anyone would like to see a picture of our booth (in .jpg
format), e-mail us privately and I'll send it to you.

Dangers, System 7, and all the others on that phat lineup!  SEE YOU
THERE! :)

Subject: RTD SF Rally & Rave Community Meeting Tomorrow!!!  IMPORTANT!!!!
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)

--------------1E52DBBC7A8575A598F15F9F
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

To one & all:

Jane Piper (formerly Progress/-/today New School Collective) ,
myself(Jen Sus- Electric Co. )& other concerned members of our rave
community have begun planning and have submitted for a permit to stage a
rally  at the SF Federal building( located @ 450 Golden Gate). The date
we have requested on the permit application is for August 10th , a
Sunday. This e-mail is to invite you to the community information
meeting we are holding tomorrow , Tues. July 29th at 7:00 PM.  It will
be held @ 50 OAK ST  in San Fran. ( please follow the signs once you are
inside ). We would like the support of  active promoters, crews, dj's,
ravers & anyone else in the sf dance/music scene  & invite you to
attend  the meeting to learn more about our goals and ideas for the
rally .  Essentially, we are trying to bring some community awareness &
health consciousness back to OUR  scene. As a collective we have a
variety of goals & aspirations  and  we would like to share ideas with
those who make up the rave family in the Bay Area.

We have contacted you because we feel you may want to show up. Simply to
express concerns or ideas you may have OR you may want to become more
deeply involved & continue come to planning meetings.  We hope you will
come & learn about what RTD SF (Right To Dance SF) as a collective,
wants to do & how , as a community we can help ourselves, our scene &
perhaps our world.  Call me hopeful......but please....call me.

For additional info on the meeting, our cause or with regards to the
rally please call me at 415-883-4343 or our info line at
or e-mail me @ this address.  Also, please feel free to tell anyone you
think should know, about this meeting.  See ya there.

~Increase Your Serenity~
Jen Susser RTD SF

--------------1E52DBBC7A8575A598F15F9F
Content-Type: text/html; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

To one &amp; all:

<P>Jane Piper (formerly Progress/-/today New School Collective) , myself(Jen
Sus- Electric Co. )&amp; other concerned members of our rave community
have begun planning and have submitted for a permit to stage a rally&nbsp;
at the SF Federal building( located @ 450 Golden Gate). The date we have
requested on the permit application is for August 10th , a Sunday. This
e-mail is to invite you to the community information meeting we are holding
tomorrow ,<B><U><BLINK> Tues. July 29th at 7:00 PM.&nbsp;</BLINK></U></B>
It will be held @ 50 OAK ST&nbsp; in San Fran. ( please follow the signs
once you are inside ). We would like the support of&nbsp; active promoters,
crews, dj's, ravers &amp; anyone else in the sf dance/music scene&nbsp;
&amp; invite you to attend&nbsp; the meeting to learn more about our goals
and ideas for the rally .&nbsp; Essentially, we are trying to bring some
community awareness &amp; health consciousness back to OUR&nbsp; scene.
As a collective we have a variety of goals &amp; aspirations&nbsp; and&nbsp;
we would like to share ideas with those who make up the rave family in
the Bay Area.

<P>We have contacted you because we feel you may want to show up. Simply
to express concerns or ideas you may have OR you may want to become more
deeply involved &amp; continue come to planning meetings.&nbsp; We hope
you will come &amp; learn about what RTD SF (Right To Dance SF) as a collective,&nbsp;
wants to do &amp; how , as a community we can help ourselves, our scene
&amp; perhaps our world.&nbsp; Call me hopeful......but please....call
me.

Hey Everybody!!!!!!

Wow! what a weekend hunh!?! Well, true love was undescribably incrediable!
The love and vibe was by far the best i have ever experenced!! My cheeks are
still sore from smiling so much!!(anybody know how to give a cheek massage?)
 I finally got the oppertunity to put some faces on these screen names and
boy were they cute!!!  

I, being the curious kiddo i am, just had to stop by 7-11 on my way to the
city just to pick up my very own can of Red Bull. Geez that stuff tastes
weird!! Its like fizzy sour blo-pop juice :o  I don't know if it effected
me...maybe it still hasn't kicked in yet :o) 

I hope i was lucky enough to give everbody a lil red button, and if you
didn't get one i'll be back down soon to give one to you with a big hug to
follow!  

When i came home on sundae i was still smiling as i drove my 3 hour drive
thruogh the heat of the bay back home to Reno, and as my car trudged over the
seirras thunder and lightenig tore through the sky...i can honestly say it
was one of the most beautiful displays of nature ever. The trees the rain the
lightening and thunder it was amazing...kinda like the wedding...Lara your
speech was breathtaking and the emotion in your voice as you read it made it
so much more powerful! you are truely beautiful and Amanda and Dustin are
lucky to have a friend such as you :o)  Amanda and Dustin...i hope all your
dreams come true and you live happily ever after!

And for all the kids i met...why is it that SFRavers are so damn cute? its a
fact, you are all perfect! Gosh i never got so many yummy hugs from such cute
kidz in my life!! i hope to see you all really soon!! 

Also Hot August Nites is gunna be in reno really really soon and i don't know
if any of you are into cars but if your gunna be up here lemme know so we can
play!!!!

You all take care...be good to each other...stay cute as always!!
...lots of all that stuff that makes you smile...
PLUR
JiL   aka Cheerio :o)

P.S. really...i wasn't hot in that vest :o)

Wow.

Ok ok...I know everyone has said it...but I gotta have my turn...TRUE LOVE
WAS INCREDIBLE. I've never felt so absolutely in phase with collective
happiness. I think some of my synapses have been rerouted.

So I have an excuse to be a little mushy...but it's not just me. A *very*
special friend visited me this weekend, true love was her first rave. She
was nervous at first, but the transformation was incredible. Krista picked
it up right away, and is still talking about how much fun she had.

Thanks to everyone who contributed to her, and my, night...beth, fubari,
jelo, ed, shua, valentine, pablo, dia, nick, becca, amber, rubilicious, ...
phew ... julie, eric, elizabeth, shannon, everyone I whose name I forgot,
everyone who I didn't meet but emanated good vibe, and of course the
newlyweds! what a way to kick off a new adventure.

Again I say, you kids are swell.

/justin

ps...who gave a beautiful girl their sfraves laminate?

 Last year was just wrong. It was not at all a festival. I am pretty sure
the cops made it that way. They were cracking down on the location, just
the week before the last Juggernaut. And the location was pretty much rank
anyways. The Bue, Iron Factory. People liked to piss on the walls inside
the building.
 The party was broken up into to little sections. When I got there only one
room was going off. But it was more like a tiny hallway. With these stairs
on both sides, that went up to nowhere. That room started sounding like 5
in da morning music around midnight.
 Then some DJ came on out side that   -tore- -it- up-    for about a half
an hour.
 There was another room discovered around 2AM. Didn't open up tell about 3.
That was the Iron factory it's self. That room was pumping at three. You
could tell all the DJ's were hyped up from waiting while the room took
shape.  Because no one was in there most of the night dancing, I guess
someone felt alittle chilly and desided to set the inside of a garbage can
on fire. Inside the building. Turns out the can was filled with alot of
plastic materials. There ended up being this really nasty cloud of gasious
polymer chemicals floating around.
 Really hard to breath.
 But. To answer your question. Spacechildren ravErs are defonetly bomb ass.




 Jeff -the has been ravEr extrodinair.

Hey you house freaks!  I just heard this DOPE house track on a tapa and was
wondering if anyone might know it from the vocal..

It's a chicago style rythm with a female vocal like...

I love the wa-I know,

I love the wa-I know,

I love the wa-I know,

I love the way you make me feel

The last part is sung...

It's on the mixed tape by Steve Loria "Live at the Moon"  by the people

Also on the same tape is another song but it's not as emotional as the last
one I [attempted to] described...

It has another distinctive house/disco chicage style beat with a piano riff
and an organ solo(played to a snare and bass beat)  It has a male vocal:

My forbiden lover

She's my forbiden lover

I love these songs and would enjoy having them in my collection.
Any help is appreciated.  Thanks alot in advance!

bye

Hey folx=)

	ya ya, I'm a new one here... kinda new to the scene inna way. Guess you
could call me a recycled rave virgin... well, not quite. I'm kinda at
the horns of a little dilemma bull. I used ta party back in the day,
then I got put in a treatment center, my folx thought I was going a wee
bit overboard with drug usage <they were right> so I stopped partyin for
3 years. then, about 6 months ago, I got bored with the AA/recovery
scene and started partyin again, but it seems like the peoples I was
around back in the day either disappeared or the way they use drugs <and
their vibe> scares me. At the same time, the people I was hanging out
with in AA kinda ditched me <their attitude being along the lines of
'oh... you've become one of 'them' again... we can't hang out with you
if you're going to be doing what 'they' do but if you want to do what we
do, come back... unfortunatly, in my eyes, what the AA ppls do seems
rather boring and umm... enough whinin, I'll leave it at that> so I'm
kinda caught in the middle, I want to get back into the scene, start
feelin that luscious vibe and being happy with it again, but lessee,
where am I going with this... I need help getting back there, and I was
hopin and wonderin if ya'll'd help me with that.

my name's hikaru<if ya don't wanna wrestle with pronouncin that, call me
mickey, most ppl do=) > I'm in Berkeley, and umm.... I dunno

				if u could help, muchas gracias=)
ps o yeah, if I'm not supposed to have put this kinda msg out there,
lemme know=)

well, i know this is totally off the subject, but i figure a few people 
could use this info:

i havent seen this reported in the news yet, but for those who dont know 
the contract for UPS and the Teamsters is up on thursday, 11:59pm.  so 
far UPS hasnt agreed to anything that the union wants, and the union 
hasnt agreed to anything UPS wants for the new contract.  so what that 
means is that there might be a strike on friday 12:01am.  for those that 
do shipping with UPS i would sudjest to use another company during this 
week, such as AirBorn Express (union company), until things get back to 
normal. this could be UPS playing high stakes poker and will hold out 
until 11:59 and then agree to what the union wants, but i highly doubt 
it. if you want more info, email me. 

thanks for your time.

From: SCiEnCe <djscience@rocketmail.com>
Subject: Re: dubplates?
To: Phil Lockwood <leaf@ted.net>, Sharif Torpis <storpis@crl.com>
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.org
Precedence: bulk

Yeah-

Dubplates are the masters that vinyl pressings are cut from. In the
UK, there is a 'culture' of dubplates surrounding the d'nb scene.
Producers cut their tracks and give them to their friends, or popular
dj's who will A) test it for crowd reaction, and B) build anticipation
for the track so that if and when it is pressed it will sell well.

Often times tunes will be on plate for as long as a year before being
pressed. Sometimes they never come out at all, as is the case with
many V.I.P. mixes.

I've called around to several record pressing plants, and noone in the
Bay Area I've found will press them individually (without a vinyl
pressing) but there are several places in that I know of in NY and L.A.

-peace-

SCiEnCe




---Phil Lockwood <leaf@ted.net> wrote:
>
> 
> i hear the terms dubplates and acetates used interchangeably (i'm
sure 
> some kind soul will correct me if i'm wrong)...  dubplates are
single 
> pressings of a track onto a cheaper medium (acetate?), which tends
to 
> have lower quality and wears out much more rapidly than a regular
vinyl 
> record.  it's typically around $50 - $60 to press an acetate - it
gives 
> the dj a chance to drop his/her track into the mix and see how it
sounds and 
> what sort of crowd response it generates...
> 
> btw, does anyone have any places in the bay area that they would 
> recommend for pressing acetates?
> 
> thanks,
> Phil
> 
> 
> > what is a dubplate? is this a limited edition vinyl pressing only
available
> > to djs?
> > 
> > 
>

Hey Kids,

		Sorry its taken us so long to post, Dustin and I have practicly slept
through thease last couple days.... hehe! 

	First off I wanna say thank you, all of you made Saturday night a night
Dustin and I will NEVER forget. It all was so incredibly beautiful, we still
cant get over it! It ment so much to us to see ALL of you upstairs for the
ceromony, it moved us in a way that we just can not explain. When I was
upstairs getting my dress on and stuff I could hear you all screaming down
stairs I thought ohmygosh this is so unbelivable! When I came down I couldent
help but cry, I could feel from all of you something that has changed my life
as well as Dustins. All of you that came out to be a part of Dustins and my
life are to us what *really* made it as beautiful as it could get, we were
reminded of what love this scene has to offer, and of what beautiful people
we both have in our lives. All we can say is *thank you all* from the bottom
of both our hearts for a night so unexplainable in words, it is keept in a
spechial place in our hearts! 

	I would also like to take this moment to thank all the people who dedicated
there time to making our wedding beautiful. A big thanks goes out to all the
DJs who took a time out from there lifes to be a part of ours. Dustin and I
thank you all from our hearts, you all are truly beautiful and your time and
dedication has moved us, thank you!
To the Crew, who came out and help us with everthing we needed that day, you
guys are so wonderful thank you for taking the time to care, we will never
forget it!
To Adam who heled me from the gecko, boy you sure do know your sound :p
thanks for helping me out so much with all those I dident know about! you are
a great guy!
To deepfog for taking time from his set to be a part of the ceromony, thanks
so much you made it beautiful and we will never forget it! 
To Verigo for being the master of ceromony, we love you so darn much =c)
To Uncle Noah for comming all the way from LA to break it down.... you got my
butt moven!
To Julie Hayes for helping me out in a big way, thanks so much sweety, you
DID make it beautiful!
To Rob Rayle and his two lovely friends, thanks for bring the sound and the
pretty lights you guys are wonderful, thanks for your help in making Sat.
beautiful!
To Spencer for his cute joke, hehe thanks for comming out sweetheart it ment
allot!
To my beautiful husband.... (thats so neat to say) husband for loving me the
way he dose
And Last but defenitly never  least in my heart Lara, for being  who she is
and sharing her angelic ways with all of us Sat. night, I love you.......
Dident she just look beautiful in her dress!

DJs who took a time out from there lifes to be a part of ours. Dustin and I
thank you all from our hearts, you all are truly beautiful and your time and
dedication has moved us, thank you!
To the Crew, who came out and help us with everthing we needed that day, you
guys are so wonderful thank you for taking the time to care, we will never
forget it!
To Adam who heled me from the gecko, boy you sure do know your sound :p
thanks for helping me out so much with all those I dident know about! you are
a great guy!
To deepfog for taking time from his set to be a part of the ceromony, thanks
so much you made it beautiful and we will never forget it! 
To Verigo for being the master of ceromony, we love you so darn much =c)
To Uncle Noah for comming all the way from LA to break it down.... you got my
butt moven!
To Julie Hayes for helping me out in a big way, thanks so much sweety, you
DID make it beautiful!
To Rob Rayle and his two lovely friends, thanks for bring the sound and the
pretty lights you guys are wonderful, thanks for your help in making Sat.
beautiful!
To Spencer for his cute joke, hehe thanks for comming out sweetheart it ment
allot!
To my beautiful husband.... (thats so neat to say) husband for loving me the
way he dose
And Last but defenitly never  least in my heart Lara, for being  who she is
and sharing her angelic ways with all of us Sat. night, I love you.......
Dident she just look beautiful in her dress!
	
	Thank you all for something so beautiful it will never be forgot, Dustin and
I love you all, you all are beautiful and represent the meaning of True Love!

from our hearts,
Amanda and Dustin Kirschenman

Hello there,
My dad has been with UPS for almost twenty years now and he was telling 
me the same stuff except that he really doesn't think that it will 
happen.  "What they wanted to do was to give us a .90 cent raise every 
other year, that's bullshit! I've been working here too damn long and 
hard to be shafted like this, I really think they'll (the teamsters 
Union) just try to negotiate.  but on the bright side, I'll be .90 
richer in the year 2000."  But sometimes everyone, even father doesn't 
know best.  Good luck to the Teamsters and UPS dudes, even you Dad   :)

Peace,
Baby Huey

PS apparently the union reps at the San Jose station took a poll to see 
if they can "recognize" a strike.  Out of 830 people, 14 voted "no"  "I 
would like to know what the f*ck those 14 people were thinking."--Pops 
Huey

CFE - Call for Entries for the Cloud Factory's new newsletter - Skyy Times

        ----------------------------------------------------------

   The Cloud Factory, a collective non-profit group based in the Monterey
Bay Area is starting a newsletter.  We are making a call for entries from
several of the communities where we feel we have roots.  This includes
the SF Bay Area, the whole West Coast rave scene and small roots in many
other places.

   The newsletter will contain several focus areas.  They include, DJ
interviews, DJ top tens, Poetry, Vegan and Vegetarian Recipes,
Environmental Updates (protest dates, places to write or email, etc.),
Inspirational Propaganda, Letters to the Editor, Upcoming Events,
Horoscopes, and Ask Mutor...(questions about sound and sound systems).  We
will be accepting entries in any and all of the focus areas.  We will also
be accepting entries for our newsletter logo and opening graphic, as well
as photography or original artwork.

   We have a core group of people who will be helping to contribute
material, edit entries and submissions and design layout.  If you have any
journalism experience or have had experience with small zines/newsletters
before, we'd love to hear comments you have, experiences, do/don'ts and
any other advice you might have for us.  Currently we plan to release a new
newsletter each quarter and have a circulation of 1500 to start with.

   Please submit text in a plain text file format, Microsoft Word, or via
an email message.  Please submit graphics in any common graphic format
(i.e. pict, tiff, jpeg, gif), EPS graphics of line art would be preferred.

   If you are interested in more information about the Cloud Factory
please see our home page at http://www.cloudfactory.org/, it's a bit
outdated but that's on our list to update too.

   Submissions can be sent to info@cloudfactory.org or submit@cloudfactory.org

Thank you

Scott Nelson
drenalin@cloudfactory.org

Please forward this email to any appropriate lists or friends that might
be interested in contributing to an exciting new newsletter.

If you'd like to be on our mailing list you can fill out a form on our web
page or call our voice mail at (408) 457-7726

-------------------------------------------------------------------
 Scott Nelson - Webmaster/System Adminstrator
   SalinasNet  > admin@salinas.net        http://www.salinas.net/
   WebWorks    > sales@webworks.org      http://www.webworks.org/
   Ultima Tool > info@ultima.org           http://www.ultima.org/
       (408) 759-2875 --- (408) 759-9675 fax
-------------------------------------------------------------------

showed up for tru luv, and that I felt it was a priveledge to help make it
happen. Also, thanks to all the DJ's who spun, and especially thanks to those
of you who spun upstairs for being so cool about letting me jam with you - I've

a bit short, that experienc totally makes up for it.

Ahhh mr. Green Jeans! The two of us have been close confidants for quite some
time, and I'd have to say that without his help I'd be a lost soul by now.
But I have decided, and this came to me just today, with the help of a really
wonderful girl, that I can no longer accompany him to his palace. After four
years of hard core smokin' and tokin' I have made the decision that I am
ready to leave his gaurdian wings, and move on to a more spiritual place of
my own. Though, I must admit that this place has been built by the strong
arms of many many good friends, and a longing of change. Someday, I hope to
be reunited, under different circumstances, with my dear friend Mr. Green
Jeans, and chat on the same level, instead of me being the student, and he
the teacher. Please help me in witnessing this major change in my life. I
think of all of you as my friends as well, friends that helped me build my
sanctuary of love, life and happiness.......


PLUR

I don't think this is a waste of time... as a person who depends on UPS
almost every day to deliver the latest kikkin' vinyl recordings, (ie
records), I appriciate very much this info.  Without it we might not get any
new records in the store this week!!!  Then the SF ravester would have to
dance to the same tunes they heard last week! AAHH!! (personally I think
there is enough good music out there already to play back to back for at
least a week without ever hearing anything twice, but the addiction to new
vinyl is a hard one to break.)  I'll go with another shipper until this
shindig is over... Thanx.

The track of which you speak is "Music for the Lonely" by Jamie Myerson 
and is taken from the Nu Emotions EP on sm:)e (1996 SM-9040-0 for you 
trainspotters out there)

The whole EP is pretty fun.  It's on white vinyl and has tracks by Sub 
Zero, DJ DB and Tommy-D and Jason Mouse as well.  If you like D&B, this 
one fits the bill.  Good stuff for warm evenings and nice sunset kinda 
times :)

Ivy and James wrote:

> Do you know what gear is needed for the campout? We're planning on
> packing light for our trip, and might not have room for the
> "equipment".
>
> Thanks
> Ivy
> reelisti@gate.net
>
> PS
> One more question: the list recently posted a bunch of letters about
> "rave fashion"........are the people that go to the clubs/raves over
> there that preoccupied with looking like a "real raver"???

 I hope this gets to you before you leave.  Sorry it's so late, but I
just got home and checked my e-mails.  As for what to bring, there is a
checklist of things to bring on the BBQ & Beats web site
<http://www.bbq-beats.org>.  The checklist is pretty extensive, but I'm
sure you'll be fine if you don't bring some of that stuff all the way
out from Florida.  You can buy some of the necessities like water,
sunscreen, etc here in the Bay Area, and some of the bigger things might
be easily borrowed..  After all, a lot of those things other people will
have and the types of people that go to these events are ones that are
more than happy to share.  I'm one of them.  I'll put the word out for
people to bring extras of things (i.e. tents, lanterns, etc.), but I'm
sure quite a few will be overprepared anyway.  Don't let the
extensiveness of the list keep you from going.  If you don't check
e-mails once you're here, you're welcome to continue corresponding by
calling me at (209) 984-3918 or (209) 984-5151.
    With regards to the rave fashion posts, I must say that we are
definitely not preoccupied with looking like a real raver.  There is no
single definition of a real raver.  We are all real ravers and we dress
as we like to.  Some ravers are preoccupied with how they dress/look,
but that isn't always going along the lines of a rave-trendy fashion,
just doing their best at their own personal style.  I said rave-trendy,
but it seems that every type of fashion is represented at parties/clubs
here.  Some people choose some more predominant styles, but really I see
an extreme mixture of personal styles more than anything.  We don't look
at ravers who wear more predominant styles as "cooler" or more of a
"real raver."  There's my 2 cents, as I'm sure is shared by many here...

     For all of you on SFRaves, I posted this to the list as well in the
hopes that you all will be most welcoming (as in the case of Ben and
Iris) to these two who are coming all the way out from Florida to visit
us.  And if you are going to be at the BBQ & Beats campout, could you
please bring extras of things if at all possible?  Please e-mail them to
let them know if you can help out in any way.  Or if you'd like, you can
e-mail me.  Anyways, hope everyone is having a wonderful week!  Be kind
and respectful to those around you.  Oh, and I have another quote down
below.
                                       Love,
                                           Julie Mae
                                      (a.k.a. SmileGrl1)
Thought for the Day:  The search for knowledge is always the correct
path to take.  It is something that, once acquired, can only add to your
spirit and beauty.  Knowledge is indeed a powerful tool and knowledge of
self is the ultimate power."
                                                      ~ S
